query: 計電及電力裝置電錶裝置功率是否越大“越好”？
response:
### 关于电力装置电表功率的评估

电力装置电表的功率并非越大越好，而是应根据实际需求进行合理选择。过高的功率可能导致不必要的费用，建议使用功率计算器来确定合适的功率，以满足实际用电需求，避免电力负荷过重。

####
answer: 電錶的裝置功率大小只代表可為該單位提供的最大電力負荷（千伏安或千瓦），即為同一時間內所使用電器的總功率，不同的功率只會影響收費計算如功率費、按金等及政府稅之計算。您可諮詢電業工程承辦商，按您的實際需要決定合適的功率以避免作出不必要的額外費用。

14. Inspection of installations (14)
14.1 The Company reserves the right to inspect the installations connected 
to its network, namely the switching and transformer substations, 
the building’s collective installations, service-entrance lines and 
Customer’s installations, as well as apparatus thereof, at any time 
and through duly authorized agents. It may also inspect and take the 
measurements deemed necessary, however, in the case of residential 
premises, such inspections are restricted to 09:00 to 18:00 schedule, 
during workdays, or any other schedule duly convened between the 
Customer and the Company to carry out the inspection.
14.2 The inspections hereinbefore referred to do not imply any liability 
of the Company, and shall not exempt the Customer from his/her 
responsibility in the state of repair and operation of the installation.
14.3 The Customer is obliged to grant access of the referred agents to the 
installation; in case of refusal or if the installation or the receptors 
therein are deemed to endanger the safety of persons and property, the 
Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply, declining 
any compensation, whereof it shall inform immediately the inspection 
entity.
14.4 The Company reserves the right to suspend the supply of electricity 
without compensation, whenever the Customer fails to execute, 
within the appointed term, the works of repair or alterations deemed 
necessary after inspection pursuant to paragraph 14.1 hereof.
15. Interruptions and restrictions to supply  (15)
15.1 Electricity supply is permanent and continual whereof interruptions 
or restrictions are only those in result of limitations to consumption 
determined by the Macau Special Administrative Region, service,

Customer or third parties or by interruption or restriction to imported

17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.

e) Fraud, as provided under paragraph 23.4;
f) Failure to update the guarantee within the term provided 
after being served notice to that effect by the Company;
g) In the situation provided under paragraph 9.4;
h) Failure to regularize default situations provided under 
paragraph 1.4 or clause 22, hereof, within the term provided 
to that effect by the Company.
16.2 Interruption of supply in situation provided under the previous 
paragraph shall not exempt the Customer from possible civil or 
criminal liability.

    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

{
    "page_content": "为进一步推动太阳能光伏并网发电的应用及鼓励投资者安装光伏系统，特区政府自2018年7月1日起实施上网电价制度，详情如下：
1. 如果太阳能光伏系统的安装容量在10千瓦以下，上网电价为每千瓦时3.7澳门币。
2. 如果系统容量在10千瓦至100千瓦之间，上网电价为每千瓦时3.4澳门币。
3. 如果系统容量在100千瓦以上至500千瓦之间，上网电价为每千瓦时3澳门币。
4. 如果系统容量在500千瓦以上，上网电价为每千瓦时2.8澳门币。

此外，有几项注意事项需要留意：1. 须寻找合资格的电业工程人员进行所需的安装工程。
2. 若安装的是非并网系统（即独立光伏系统），建议考虑增设储电池。
3. 安装时必须做好防漏水措施，确保设备安全。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/smart-living/photovoltaic-system-(pv)/feed-in-tariff/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/smart-living/photovoltaic-system-(pv)/feed-in-tariff/"
    }
}

    "page_content": "更改订定功率 (电表大小)
申请人(1):
必须为电能供应合约持有人
所需文件(2):
1.申请人身份证明文件副本 (3)(4)
2.如有需要，另须提供最近三个月发出的查屋纸以供审批
如申请单位为非住宅用途，另须提供:
1.电力装置位置图(7)（适用于申请功率高于20.7千伏安）
2.「电力装置用途/电业工程人员声明书」 (8)及其身份证明文
件副本
3.土地工务局发出以申请人及订定功率申请的电力装置使用
准照(9)
应付费用:
1.若所申请的功率高于该楼宇所注册的最大功率时，需缴交
附加之电缆接驳费
2.工程费用(如需要)
3.新旧按金的差额
所需时间:
四个工作天内完成(10)(11)",

补充内容：
如果申请单位涉及特别用途或有其他特殊要求，需额外提交相关文件（例如特殊行业许可证、相关行政审批文件等）。
应付费用：
需缴交附加之电缆接驳费（如需要）
工程费用（如需要）
按金（根据所申请的订定功率收取）
补充内容：
按金费用是根据申请的功率来决定的，且通常在后续结算时进行调整。
费用标准可能根据实际情况有所变化，请参考澳电最新的收费表。
订定功率及按金费标准：
3.4千伏安 (1x16安培) 澳门币 65.00
6.9千伏安 (1x32安培) 澳门币 132.00
11.5千伏安 (1x50安培) 澳门币 219.00
13.8千伏安 (3x20安培) 澳门币 399.00
20.7千伏安 (3x32安培) 澳门币 598.00
34.5千伏安 (3x50安培) 澳门币 854.00
补充内容：
以上费用标准适用于不同功率要求的客户，具体费用可能会根据地区、项目复杂度或特定需求有所变化。
需要注意的是，标准费用适用于常规安装，对于高功率或特殊安装需求可能需要额外费用。

四个工作天内完成

{
    "page_content": "1. **供电技术资料**
   - 供电条件规范
   - 客户变电房土建设计与施工
   - 澳电技术规范

2. **停电措施**
   - 预先通知澳电会提前将「暂停供电通告」分发到受影响之商户或物业管理公司，或张贴于大厦出入口。您亦可随时于网上查询受影响客户名单。查看通告。

3. **计划性暂停供电**
   - 为确保优质的供电服务，澳电必须定期维修及改善供电设施，而在工程进行期间，无可避免地我们需要暂时中断电力供应。

4. **供电故障**
   - 若整座大厦或区域皆受影响，有可能是发生供电故障，我们会尽快为您恢复电力供应。
   - 若您的居住单位突然停电，但邻居的单位却供电正常，请关掉所有主要的电器用具，然后首先检查室内总开关掣。
   - 若电力恢复供应，可能因电力负荷过重而引致停电，您可考虑申请提高订定功率（加大电表）。
   - 若断路器是接合上，但仍然没有电力供应，这可能是您的电力装置可能出现问题，您应向有经验的电器技工咨询。
   - 无论基于任何理由而导致停电，请致电我们的抢修服务热线2833 9922。

5. **电压骤降**
   - 电压骤降不是停电，其发生过程中电力供应并没有中断。
   - 减低电压骤降的影响对电压波动敏感的设备，如升降机、水泵、灯具或制冷系统会受到短暂影响。

23.3 When suspicion of fraudulent procedure arises, the Company shall 
request the presence of two witnesses, duly credentialed by competent 
authorities, to confirm or deny the existence of fraud.
23.4 When the existence of fraud is confirmed and imputable to the 
Customer, the Company reserves the right:
a) To be reimbursed for the amount corresponding to energy 
illicitly consumed and of any expenses related to the 
elimination of the fraud, namely the repair or replacement 
of damaged equipment;
b) To withhold supply until full payment is made of the amount 
due according to the previous subparagraph.
24. Value of energy illicitly consumed  (24)
24.1 The value of the energy illicitly consumed is computed by the 
Company, based on the highest tariff set for the subgroup contracted 
by the Customer, plus 25%, taking into account all the facts relevant 
to the computation of real consumption during the period wherein 
the fraudulent procedure took place, namely the characteristics of the 
installation, its schedule of operation, previous readings, if any, and 
posterior readings, if necessary.
24.2 When there are no elements to allow an objective computation of 
energy illicitly consumed, the relevant value is computed using the 
following rules:
a) Low-voltage Customers
Pc up to 20.7 kV A ................. 50-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 34.5kV A to 69 kV ..... 70-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 100 kV A to 340 kV A .100-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc above 340 kV A ........... 200-hour monthly usage of Pc
b) Medium-voltage Customers .... 300-hour monthly usage of Pc
Whereof “Pc” is the demand subscribed by the Customer
24.3 Estimation performed in the terms of the previous paragraph 
comprises the period in relation thereto proof was presented wherein 
such irregular consumption was maintained or, if such evidence does 
not exist, a period of thirty-six months.",

    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

7. Temporary contracts  (7)
7.1 The Company may sign temporary electricity supply contracts for 
non-permanent installations, for a pre-determined limited term, 
provided technical conditions are favorable to that effect and that 
inconvenience to the distribution network may not result therefrom.
7.2 Temporary electricity supply contracts imply the installation of 
provisional branch lines.
8. Contractual term  (8)
8.1 Ordinary electricity supply contracts are signed for an initial term of 
one month, automatically and successively renewable for the same 
period, notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph 8.3 hereof.
8.2 Temporary contracts have a limited term, wherefore the beginning 
and the end of their validity is explicitly set in the supply contract.
8.3 The Customer, in written and with a minimum notice of five working 
days, must inform the Company of his/her intention to terminate any 
contract signed under the terms provided in paragraphs 8.1 and 8.2 
hereof, wherefore the Customer shall be liable for any amount due 
until the removal of the meters, which shall be carried out during the 
same period.
8.4 The term for special large customer contracts is specified in the 
respective supply contract pursuant to clause 6 hereof.",

query: 為何我的電錶有別於鄰居?
response:
## 电表差异的原因

您可能会发现您的电表与邻居的电表不同，主要是因为每个用户的电力消耗需求和使用模式是不同的。电表的类型和规格通常是根据客户的用电情况和合同安排而定的。此外，电力公司会根据不同用户的消费量和需求提供相应的电表和服务。

###
answer:
### 电表差异的原因

您的电表与邻居的不同可能是由于用电需求、设备选择及安装条件等因素造成的。澳电会根据每个客户的具体用电情况选择合适的电表，并负责电表的安装和维护。此外，电表的类型和规格可能因不同的用电合约而有所不同。若您想了解更详细的信息，建议联系澳电客服。

**

officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.

preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the

thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.

the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the

{
    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

{
    "page_content": "A组收费
适用于以低压电网(230/400伏特)供电的客户：
•   其订定功率在69千伏安以下，或
•   其订定功率高于69千伏安，但未被包括在B组及C组收费内。

收费类别
A1 - 一般收费
A2 - 平民收费
A3 - 社会慈善机构收费
A4 - 社会援助收费

收费
A组收费根据下列项目计算：
订定功率2 (以千伏安计算)
•   供电合约所订定的最大电力负荷，由电表规格及其保护设备所控制。
电费 (以千瓦时(度)计算)
•   于用电期间的总耗电量。
收费调整系数
•   收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。
政府税
•   就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。
备注
(1) 86年8月30日之第35/86/M号法令。
(2) 2005年7月18日之第11/2005号行政法规。
(3) 2004年8月9日之第23/2004号行政命令。  
(4) 2007年3月19日之第5/2007号行政法规。
(5) 税项的计算方式按客户电力装置种类而定（住宅、商业或工业）。",

        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/uploads/pdf_education_Tariff_A_zh_881af653dd.pdf",

    }
}

    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

15.9 Notices of supply interruption shall contain a warning of live

16. Suspension of supply  (16)
16.1 The Company may suspend the supply of electricity when any of the 
following events imputable to the Customer occur:
a) Noncompliance with provisions that aim to eliminate 
any type of disruption to network operation and other 
installations, as well as in concern to the safety of persons 
and property;
b) Impossibility to read meters as covered by clause 17 
hereof;
c) Opposition to inspection of installations within the 
appointed schedule;
d) Failure to pay bills for energy consumption and demand, as 
well as any additional charges and services, within the term 
provided;
e) Fraud, as provided under paragraph 23.4;
f) Failure to update the guarantee within the term provided 
after being served notice to that effect by the Company;
g) In the situation provided under paragraph 9.4;
h) Failure to regularize default situations provided under 
paragraph 1.4 or clause 22, hereof, within the term provided 
to that effect by the Company.
16.2 Interruption of supply in situation provided under the previous 
paragraph shall not exempt the Customer from possible civil or 
criminal liability.
16.3 In the case provided under subparagraph 16.1 d), the Company 
reserves the right to withhold reconnection from the Customer until 
all outstanding bills are paid and, if necessary, the guarantee referred 
to under clause 4, hereof duly replenished, wherefore reconnection is 
subject to the payment of a charge in the terms of the Law.",

    "page_content": "88
Final Provisions
22. Private generation  (22)
22.1 A Customer with private electricity generation is allowed to use the 
energy generated by its own plant only in case of emergency and 
limited duration tests, except for specially authorized cases under the 
terms and conditions to be provided in the relevant supply contract.
22.2 The Customer, when signing the electricity supply contract or later, 
upon installation, is obliged to inform the Company, in written, of the 
existence at the premises of its own means of generation.
22.3 Except through written permission from the Company, attached as 
schedule to the relevant electricity supply contract including technical 
rules to be observed, a Customer who owns a private electricity 
generator is not allowed to operate its own plant in parallel with the 
public network.
23. Fraud (23)
23.1 Any fraudulent procedure susceptible to forge the reading of energy 
or the demand, namely the capture of electricity prior (“upstream”) 
to the meter, tampering of meters or demand control devices, as well 
as alterations to safety devices performed through the breaking of the 
seal or lock, is considered a noncompliance of the electricity supply 
contract.
23.2 Any fraudulent procedures detected within an installation that uses 
electricity located inside a residential unit or any other compound or 
location wherein the Customer has exclusive access or subjected to 
the control thereof, is considered, unless otherwise proven, imputable 
to the Customer.",

entities.description: Meter Reading is the process of measuring the amount of electricity consumed by a customer to determine billing.<SEP>Meter Reading refers to the periodic evaluation of the Customer's energy consumption as recorded by the metering equipment.
Energy Metering refers to the process of measuring energy consumption and demand, which is essential for accurate billing and service provision.
Metering equipment is used to measure energy consumption and demand, and is supplied and maintained by the Company.
The metering system is installed by the Company to measure electricity consumption at the Customer's installation.
Metering Systems are devices used to measure electricity consumption, for which the Company is responsible for maintenance and repair.
Billing Procedures outline the methods and timelines for charging Customers for their electricity consumption based on meter readings.
Metering Device is a device used to measure the amount of electricity consumed by the Customer, which is subject to inspection by the Company.
Meter Reading Impossibility refers to situations where The Company cannot read the Customer's electricity meter, affecting billing and service.
Metering Errors refer to inaccuracies in energy and demand measurements that require correction to ensure fair billing.

relationships.description: 澳电assists customers in adjusting their电表size based on their electricity consumption needs.<SEP>澳电utilizes electric meters to measure customer consumption for billing purposes.<SEP>澳电is responsible for the installation and maintenance of electric meters, ensuring their proper functioning.
The Customer's Electricity Consumption is monitored and billed by the Company based on usage over time.
The Meter Reading is conducted to assess the Customer's electricity consumption for billing purposes.
Electric Meter Testing is a service provided by澳电to ensure accurate billing for customers.
The Customer has the right to request Meter Testing to verify the accuracy of their electricity meter.
The Company requires the installation of Metering Devices to accurately measure the Customer's electricity consumption.
The Company is responsible for managing energy metering processes to ensure accurate billing for customers.
电表measures the electricity consumption that directly impacts the calculation of电费.
The Company bills customers based on their electricity consumption, which is measured monthly.
澳电is responsible for providing electricity supply to the property (物业) and managing the smart meter installation.
The Customer must allow inspection of the Metering Device to ensure accurate billing and compliance with safety standards.
The Customer is responsible for their Energy Consumption, which is monitored and billed by the Company.
The Customer is impacted by metering errors, which can lead to incorrect billing and requires correction by the Company.
If the Customer does not allow access for meter reading, it can lead to billing issues and potential service suspension.
The Company is responsible for conducting Meter Readings to ensure accurate billing of the Customer's electricity usage.
The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.
The Customer's electricity usage is monitored within their Residential Unit, where they have exclusive access.
The Company supplies and maintains metering equipment necessary for billing electricity consumption.
The Company is responsible for the maintenance and repair of the Metering Systems that measure electricity usage.
澳电manages the smart meters (智能电表) and ensures they are operational for electricity supply.
The Customer benefits from Billing Corrections, which ensure they are charged accurately for their energy consumption.

query: 為何澳電不為我作電力裝置維修?
response:
### 原因说明

根据知识图谱信息，客户负责维护和修理自己的电力装置，澳电仅在客户完成必要的工程后进行检查和锁表。若客户未能妥善维护电力装置，或因故障导致的停电，客户需自行聘请专业电工进行检查和维修。此外，澳电还提供紧急服务热线供客户报告供电故障，助其恢复电力供应。

**
answer:
### 为何澳电不为您作电力装置维修？

根据相关规定，客户对其电力装置的维护和修理负有责任，澳电仅负责其自身的计量系统及保护装置的维护。客户应确保其电力装置处于良好状态，并在发现任何缺陷时及时通知澳电。若因客户未能满足安全规定或安装维护要求，澳电有权暂停供电服务。此外，客户若未能完成必要的维护或改造工作，澳电也不会负责维修。 

**

docs.content:
{
    "page_content": "客户的防洪措施

为加强输配电系统的可靠度和稳定性，澳电会定期进行供电系统的保养及维修工作，包括变电站、中压网络、低压网络、直至连接客户住宅或办公室/工厂的交接点，包括公共配电网络及其相关供电设施。在有需要时，澳电亦会随时检查大厦内的用户共用电力装置。

修订「低洼地区新建筑物电力装置的技术规范」为提升低洼地区新建筑物的防灾抗灾能力，经与相关部门沟通和协调后，澳电于2018年9月完成了该技术规范，强制将新建楼宇的电力装置，包括变压房、总掣柜及电表箱等电力装置安装在澳门特区政府订定的防浸高度以上，以尽量减低新建楼宇的电力装置受水浸影响。

客户负责的范围

现有楼宇方面，大厦内的用户共用电力设施属业主共同拥有，一般安装在大厦入口地面层，倘客户没有将其相应升高，仍会受水浸损坏而影响供电。为长远减低水浸所带来的影响，达致最佳防洪效果，业主亦可聘请有经验的电业承办商参考已修订的「低洼地区新建筑物电力装置的技术规范」，对大厦内的用户共用电力装置进行升高，全面提升防灾抗灾能力。

此外，若不幸在风灾期间受水浸影响，业主可于水退后自行聘请电业承办商进行检查和维修，以便尽快恢复电力供应和确保安全用电。

如何升高大厦内的电力装置？

市民或大厦业主如有需要将其供电设备升高，客户应聘用有经验的电业承办商，并向澳电提出相关工程申请。客户可电邮至customer.centre@cem-macau.com向澳电提出申请。如对电力方面的防灾工作有疑问或查询可致电：2833 9911。一般来说，需升高现有分线电箱的电表及公众用电设施至高于防浸高度的水平以上，工作范围包括：确认防浸高度为+4.21msl以上，检查现场情况以升高安装水平，同时考虑到现有的建筑限制并且不会影响操作和安全要求，提供个别设计以供审批并指出：i) 上升线总制板的地点；ii) 于线头箱和上升线总制板之间或上升线总制板和上升分线箱（包括必要的土建工程）之间电缆可能需要重新安装。上升线总制板改动期间，如果客户要求，澳电将提供临时供电，确保电缆连接入口具备防水功能，可以进一步加强防水浸效能。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/our-community/optimizing-power-facilities-in-low-lying-areas/customers-flood-control-measures/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/our-community/optimizing-power-facilities-in-low-lying-areas/customers-flood-control-measures/"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "供电条件规范 - 摘要  
合约的范围澳电将按照所有规章及客户所定的功率供应电力。   
合约的条件  
2.1 供电合约的有效期为一个月，得以相同期限自动续期。  
2.2 如客户欲取消合约，应最少提前五个工作日书面通知澳电，并负责缴清所有关于用电量及功率的欠款。   

供应电力的可靠性及中断  
3.1 电力的供应是不间断和持续的，其中断或限制只能因工作理由、意外或不可抗力的原因、事先协议或可归责于客户的行为而发生。  
3.5 凡属计划性停电，澳电需要提前36小时逐一通知客户；若未能逐一通知时，将透过传播媒界通知客户。  

电费  
8.1 电费最迟应于抄表后十五天内在澳电办事处缴付或按账单背面所指的方式透过指定机构缴付。  
8.2 如截至载于账单上的缴费日期仍未缴费，则须就欠款金额缴付附加费，且可在自上述日期起计五个工作天后被暂停供电。  

按金  
9.1 签约时，澳电有权要求户缴交按金，其全部或部分可用于缴付客户欠缴的部分或全部费用。  
9.3 合约届满时，按金将在扣除客户欠缴的费用后发还。  

投诉及要求  
10.1 澳电欢迎客户透过资询通及/或其他渠道就我们的服务作出要求及/或投诉。  
10.2 客户进行有关账单的投诉时，所有调整中的欠缴费用将暂时无须缴付直至得出调查结果为止。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/about-cem/power-supply-technical-information/standard-condition-of-supply/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/about-cem/power-supply-technical-information/standard-condition-of-supply/"
    }
}

14. Inspection of installations (14)
14.1 The Company reserves the right to inspect the installations connected 
to its network, namely the switching and transformer substations, 
the building’s collective installations, service-entrance lines and 
Customer’s installations, as well as apparatus thereof, at any time 
and through duly authorized agents. It may also inspect and take the 
measurements deemed necessary, however, in the case of residential 
premises, such inspections are restricted to 09:00 to 18:00 schedule, 
during workdays, or any other schedule duly convened between the 
Customer and the Company to carry out the inspection.
14.2 The inspections hereinbefore referred to do not imply any liability 
of the Company, and shall not exempt the Customer from his/her 
responsibility in the state of repair and operation of the installation.
14.3 The Customer is obliged to grant access of the referred agents to the 
installation; in case of refusal or if the installation or the receptors 
therein are deemed to endanger the safety of persons and property, the 
Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply, declining 
any compensation, whereof it shall inform immediately the inspection 
entity.
14.4 The Company reserves the right to suspend the supply of electricity 
without compensation, whenever the Customer fails to execute, 
within the appointed term, the works of repair or alterations deemed 
necessary after inspection pursuant to paragraph 14.1 hereof.
15. Interruptions and restrictions to supply  (15)
15.1 Electricity supply is permanent and continual whereof interruptions 
or restrictions are only those in result of limitations to consumption 
determined by the Macau Special Administrative Region, service, 
fortuitous events or force majeure, prior accord, acts imputable to the 
Customer or third parties or by interruption or restriction to imported 
electricity supply.",

17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.

 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

{
    "page_content": "1. **供电技术资料**
   - 供电条件规范
   - 客户变电房土建设计与施工
   - 澳电技术规范

2. **停电措施**
   - 预先通知澳电会提前将「暂停供电通告」分发到受影响之商户或物业管理公司，或张贴于大厦出入口。您亦可随时于网上查询受影响客户名单。查看通告。

3. **计划性暂停供电**
   - 为确保优质的供电服务，澳电必须定期维修及改善供电设施，而在工程进行期间，无可避免地我们需要暂时中断电力供应。

4. **供电故障**
   - 若整座大厦或区域皆受影响，有可能是发生供电故障，我们会尽快为您恢复电力供应。
   - 若您的居住单位突然停电，但邻居的单位却供电正常，请关掉所有主要的电器用具，然后首先检查室内总开关掣。
   - 若电力恢复供应，可能因电力负荷过重而引致停电，您可考虑申请提高订定功率（加大电表）。
   - 若断路器是接合上，但仍然没有电力供应，这可能是您的电力装置可能出现问题，您应向有经验的电器技工咨询。
   - 无论基于任何理由而导致停电，请致电我们的抢修服务热线2833 9922。

5. **电压骤降**
   - 电压骤降不是停电，其发生过程中电力供应并没有中断。
   - 减低电压骤降的影响对电压波动敏感的设备，如升降机、水泵、灯具或制冷系统会受到短暂影响。

这些内容为用户提供了相关的服务、流程和联系方式等信息。",

25. Customer’s rights (25)
25.1 The Customer is granted the right to apply from the inspection 
entity:
a) An inspection of the electric installation if convinced not to 
be the perpetrator of any fraud;
b) An arbitration on the indemnity to be paid to the Customer 
for unreasonable termination or suspension of supply on 
the part of the Company;
c) An arbitration over the amount paid in consequence of the 
fraudulent behavior, when considered excessive.
25.2 When through the inspection referred to in subparagraph a) of the 
previous paragraph, it has been found that there is no fraud or the 
fraud is not imputable to the Customer, the Customer may demand 
from the Company the repair or replacement deemed necessary to 
restore the electric installation to its proper working condition and 
the immediate reconnection of electricity supply.
26. Jurisdiction  (26)
 The Court of Law in the Macau Special Administrative Region will 
entertain jurisdiction over any disputes that may arise between the 
Customer and the Company.",

    "page_content": "时刻保持警惕　慎防伪冒讯息

 1. 真正的澳电的通讯方式：
   - 电邮：customer.centre@cem-macau.com；info@cem-macau.com
   - 网上服务：[https://e-service.cem-macau.com/](https://e-service.cem-macau.com/)
   - 网站：[https://www.cem-macau.com](https://www.cem-macau.com)
   - 短讯：853660128339933 或 853660163050000

2. 如果接到可疑电邮、来电或讯息，应采取的措施：
   - 如接到可疑来电，应保持冷静并即时挂断电话
   - 切勿点击短讯或电邮内的任何连结或下载任何附件
   - 检查连结的网页是否使用澳电的官方域名，即 cem-macau.com或cem.mo
   - 立即删除可疑短讯或电邮
   - 如有怀疑，请致电资询通2833 9911或电邮至customer.centre@cem-macau.com，亦可亲临澳电客服中心，并提供可疑短讯或电邮的来电号码、寄件者的电邮地址、内容或截图，以供核实。

3. 若怀疑被骗，应怎么办：
   - 如你怀疑被骗，请尽快向警方寻求协助。
   - 如怀疑接到诈骗电话或存在相关犯罪时，可致电司法警察局24小时防诈骗查询热线 8800 7777。
   - 如要报案，请致电司法警察局报案热线993。详情请浏览司法警察局网站。

该信息可以帮助用户识别和应对潜在的诈骗信息。",

{
    "page_content": "检查电表
申请人:
任何客户
所需文件:
无
应付费用:
若确实电表运作正常，本公司将于下月电费单内收取澳门币
100元的检查费
所需时间:
四个工作天内完成(10)
备注: 
(1) 如申请人未能亲身办理申请，可签署授权书以委托他人代办。
(2) 如申请涉及合并单位，另须提供土地工务局核准的更改工程(修改)计划。
(3) 澳门居民身份证、香港居民身份证、中华人民共和国居民身份证或各国护照。
(4) 如申请人为公司/社团，须提供最近三个月发出的公司商业/社团登记副本及其电能供
应合约须由法定代表人签署。
(5) 如最近三个月发出的查屋纸仍未更改为新的业权人，客户可再递交经律师见证的买卖楼
宇合约／银行三方约／屋契／物业转移税单（M1&M2）副本作参考，但需审批。
(6) 如以租户身份申请，则无需提供业权人的身份证明文件副本。
(7) 位置图须清晰显示客户电力装置及电表的所在位置。如有需要，需提供进一步的资料。
(8) 此声明书须由申请人或公司/社团的法定代表人签署。「电业工程人员声明书」部份只
适用于具备电力装置使用准照的供电申请及更改订定功率申请。
(9) 指电力装置属第35/2011号行政法规的适用范围内。
(10)指澳电可自由进出电力装置处。
(11)不涉及任何客户或澳电工程，并已缴付相应费用。
(12)申请单位必须为空置。
(13)指澳电已确认申请人所提交之文件，并已缴付相应费用。

}

{
    "page_content": "
1. 个人资料处理声明  
   - 澳电依据澳门第8/2005号《个人资料保护法》处理个人资料，资料包括姓名、地址、电话号码、电表号、身份证号码、电邮等。

2. 资料收集来源  
   - 来自用户主动提供、业务过程中产生的信息及其他合法途径。

3. 资料使用目的  
   - 提供及维护电力服务  
   - 账单处理与支付  
   - 客户服务与沟通  
   - 市场推广及宣传  
   - 法律合规及风险管理

4. 资料保护原则  
   - 只收集必要资料  
   - 资料安全保护，防止未经授权访问  
   - 未经同意不会披露给第三方，除非法律要求或合作提供服务

5. 资料保留期限  
   - 仅在达成目的期间保留，之后删除或匿名化处理

6. 用户权利  
   - 查阅、更正、删除个人资料  
   - 随时取消直销推广资料接收

7. 身份验证  
   - 核实用户身份后处理相关请求

8. 投诉渠道  
   - 用户可向澳门个人资料保护办公室投诉

9. 联系方式  
   - 联系电邮：customer.centre@cem-macau.com  
   - 通讯地址：澳门马交石炮台马路澳电大楼

10. 声明更新  
    - 隐私声明可能不时更新，最新版本公布于官网

entities.description: 抢修服务热线is the emergency hotline provided by澳电for customers to report power outages and faults.
This includes the contact information provided by澳电for customer inquiries and support.

relationships.description: 客户can request assistance from澳电for inspections and upgrades to their electrical installations to prevent flood damage.<SEP>客户must adhere to the terms set by澳电in the电力供应合约for electricity supply.<SEP>客户must complete electrical work and notify澳电for meter locking, indicating a service relationship.
relationships.keywords: customer obligations,customer service,customer support,installation process,service agreement,service request

relationships.description: The Customer is responsible for maintaining their installations to ensure continuous electricity supply.<SEP>The Customer receives Electricity Supply, which is governed by the Company's metering and billing practices.
澳电addresses供电故障by quickly restoring power to affected areas and providing guidance to customers.

The Customer is entitled to demand repairs or replacements for the Electric Installation if fraud is not found.<SEP>The Customer's electric installation is affected during supply interruptions, which must be treated as live for safety reasons.
The Customer is responsible for the maintenance and repair of their own installation, which includes various electrical components.
The Customer is responsible for the maintenance of the Service-Entrance Line that connects to their installation.
申请人applies to澳电for the electricity meter inspection service, indicating a customer-service provider relationship.
澳电charges customers electricity fees based on their consumption measured by electric meters.<SEP>澳电charges customers电费based on their electricity consumption as per the contract terms.
电能供应合约的持有人必须与澳电签订合同，以申请更改电表大小。
"Customers can call the抢修服务热线to report issues directly to澳电for immediate assistance.")

query: 如需遷移電錶位，我應怎樣做呢？
response:
### 遷移電錶位置的步驟

如需遷移電錶位，您首先需提交一份申請，並附上所需的文件，包括電力裝置位置圖、身份證明文件副本等。具體要求包括電力裝置用途/電業工程人員聲明書及相關的許可證明，若您是公司或社團，還需提交最近三個月的商業登記副本。申請完成後，通常需四個工作天來處理，若有任何問題，建議聯繫客服以獲得更多協助。

### 參考資料

[DC] doc_40_9c2dcdb276b2c58bf7d4896c644dc2e8.json
answer: 如您有需要更改電錶位置，請留言給我們或致電澳電資詢通2833 9911，我們將與您商討有關遷移計劃的可行性。 在確認計劃後，建議您聘請有經驗的電業承辦商跟進電錶板的遷移工程。在獲得我們的稽查人員檢查符合標準後，澳電才會完成電錶的遷移。

申请人:
任何客户
所需文件:
无
应付费用:
若确实电表运作正常，本公司将于下月电费单内收取澳门币
100元的检查费

四个工作天内完成(10)

(1) 如申请人未能亲身办理申请，可签署授权书以委托他人代办。
(2) 如申请涉及合并单位，另须提供土地工务局核准的更改工程(修改)计划。
(3) 澳门居民身份证、香港居民身份证、中华人民共和国居民身份证或各国护照。

应合约须由法定代表人签署。
(5) 如最近三个月发出的查屋纸仍未更改为新的业权人，客户可再递交经律师见证的买卖楼
宇合约／银行三方约／屋契／物业转移税单（M1&M2）副本作参考，但需审批。

Sale of Electricity
17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

Meter testing (21)\n21.1 The Company may, at its convenience, test the meters installed in its \ndistribution network waiving the collection of any charge for such \nservice; such testing shall be performed in such a manner as to avoid \nbreaking off the seals placed by the inspection entity.\n21.2 The Customer reserves the right to request the testing of its meter, \nwhether by the Company or the inspection entity, whereof if the \nmeter is found to meet the specifications approved by the Macau \nSpecial Administrative Region, with corresponding costs borne by \nthe Customer.\n21.3 Meter testing costs chargeable to the Customer shall be fixed by the \nMacau Special Administrative Region.\n21.4 Whenever the statutory allowances are exceeded, both the Customer \nand the Company reserve the right to claim reimbursement, as the \ncase may be and pursuant to clause 20 hereof.",

{
    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

{
    "page_content": "77Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
12.3 The Company shall carry out itself or subcontract the works deemed 
necessary to the setting of electric lines deemed necessary to connect 
the installation of the Customer to the low or medium-voltage 
network, after the payment of due shared costs in the terms of relevant 
legislation.
12.4 When an increase in capacity, whether in low or medium-voltage, may 
result in shared costs, the Company shall only charge the Customer 
the difference between the new costs to be shared and the amount 
corresponding to the capacity for which the connection charge has 
been previously paid.
12.5 The Company is responsible to execute the installation of electric 
lines leading to the pothead, or directly to the main collective 
switchboard or the Customer’s installation, as well as to setup the 
metering system.
12.6 The Customer is responsible to install the pothead supplied by the 
Company, supply and setup all service-entrance lines, main collective 
switchboard, collective lines, collective line distributing boxes, boxes 
for the fixation of metering devices and respective accessories as well 
as service circuit breakers, according to the electric installation design 
approved by the competent authorities and under the inspection of the 
Company.
12.7 When an application for electricity supply or increased capacity cannot 
be performed from existing low-voltage network, the Customer must 
provide a space wherein a transformer substation may be installed, in 
the terms of the concession contract and relevant legislation.
12.8 The Customer is responsible for the civil works necessary to install 
a transformer substation in the space provided under the previous 
paragraph, wherein the supply and fixation of doors, grids, ventilation 
ducts, fans, gutter metal covers and earthing network is included, 
according to the drawings provided by the Company, as well as 
the installation of an automatic fire extinguisher system whenever 
required.",

{
    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

{
    "page_content": "申请供电所需文件：
业权人身份证明文件副本
最近三个月发出的查屋纸
如申请人为租户，另须提供：
租户身份证明文件副本
已公证的租约副本
如申请单位为非住宅用途，另须提供：
电力装置位置图（适用于申请功率高于20.7千伏安）
《电力装置用途/电业工程人员声明书》及其身份证明文件副本
土地工务局发出以申请人及订定功率申请的电力装置使用许可证
补充内容：
如果申请单位涉及特别用途或有其他特殊要求，需额外提交相关文件（例如特殊行业许可证、相关行政审批文件等）。
应付费用：
需缴交附加之电缆接驳费（如需要）
工程费用（如需要）
按金（根据所申请的订定功率收取）
补充内容：
按金费用是根据申请的功率来决定的，且通常在后续结算时进行调整。
费用标准可能根据实际情况有所变化，请参考澳电最新的收费表。
订定功率及按金费标准：
3.4千伏安 (1x16安培) 澳门币 65.00
6.9千伏安 (1x32安培) 澳门币 132.00
11.5千伏安 (1x50安培) 澳门币 219.00
13.8千伏安 (3x20安培) 澳门币 399.00
20.7千伏安 (3x32安培) 澳门币 598.00
34.5千伏安 (3x50安培) 澳门币 854.00
补充内容：
以上费用标准适用于不同功率要求的客户，具体费用可能会根据地区、项目复杂度或特定需求有所变化。
需要注意的是，标准费用适用于常规安装，对于高功率或特殊安装需求可能需要额外费用。
所需时间：
四个工作天内完成

客户的电力工程：步骤和要求的相关信息 补充内容：
客户需要按照规定的步骤进行工程申请，包括设计方案的审批、施工准备、设备安装等环节。
所有电力工程必须符合澳电的安全标准，并通过必要的验收程序。
电力加大评估及功率计算器的使用说明 补充内容：
澳电提供功率计算器工具，帮助客户评估所需的电力容量，并根据实际需求选择合适的功率。

[1] 如申请人未能亲身办理申请， 可签署授权书以委托他人代办。
[2] 如申请涉及合并单位，另须提供土地工务局核准的更改工程 (修改) 计划。
[3] 澳门居民身份证、香港居民身份证、中华人民共和国居民身份证或各国护照。
[4] 如申请人为公司/社团，须提供最近三个月发出的公司商业/社团登记副本及其电能供应合约须由法定代表人签署。
[5] 如最近三个月发出的查屋纸仍未更改为新的业权人，客户可再递交经律师见证的买卖楼宇合约／银行三方约／屋契／物业转移税单（M1&M2）副本作参考，但需审批。
[6] 如以租户身份申请，则无需提供业权人的身份证明文件副本。
[7] 位置图须清晰显示客户电力装置及电表的所在位置。如有需要，需提供进一步的资料。
[8] 此声明书须由申请人或公司/ 社团的法定代表人签署。「电业工程人员声明书」部份只适用于具备电力装置使用准照的供电申请及更改订定功率申请。
[9] 指电力装置属第3 5 /2 0 1 1 号行政法规的适用范围内。
[10] 指澳电可自由进出电力装置处。
[11] 不涉及任何客户或澳电工程，并已缴付相应费用。",

    }
}

{
    "page_content": "私人电动车供电申请

申请前须知：申请人需就相关停车场/车位之登记分类并遵守以下法规: 若为独立业权之停车位，可根据第14/2017号法律《分层建筑物共同部分的管理法律制度》之相关规定，在楼宇入口的大堂及进行工程范围附近的显眼处张贴有关工程通知15日，同时如楼宇设有管委会，亦应一并以书面方式通知管委会；若以一独立停车场作为业权登记内的停车位(主要是2000年前以业权份额作登记)，须按民法典要求取得停车场三分之二业权人同意；倘若没有改变原有楼宇供电功率的情况下，则只须取得停车场二分之一业权人同意；若停车位业权登记属建筑物之共同部份，则须按第14/2017号法律《分层建筑物共同部分的管理法律制度》第二十九条第一款的要求，取得经出席会议的分层建筑物所有人的过半数票通过，且其份额至少须在分层建筑物总值中占百分之十五同意。

申请步骤：请向我们咨询供电可行性。取得供电可行性回复后，另需聘请 注册技术员 及 电业工程人员 编制安装充电设施的电力设计方案，并提交土地工务局审批。取得土地工务局核准的电力设计方案(即盖章图则)后，于图则上按查屋纸所示，清楚标示相关停车位名称或号码，再递交至澳电，我们就客户电力装置与电网的接驳进行规划。

所需文件：
1. 咨询供电可行性所需文件: 
   - 申请的订定功率-千瓦 (充电器大小) 
   - 由澳门物业登记局最近3个月内发出的停车位物业登记书面报告 (即查屋纸) 能清晰显示车位地点的资料(如大厦及车位平面图、图片等) 
2. 私人电动车供电申请所需文件: 
   - 业权人身份证明文件副本 
   - 由澳门物业登记局最近3个月内发出的停车位物业登记书面报告 (即查屋纸) 
   - 「电力装置用途/电业工程人员声明书」及其身份证明文件副本 
   - 土地工务局核准的电力设计方案(即盖章图则) 
   - 土地工务局发出以申请人及订定功率申请的电力装置使用准照 
   - 如申请人为租户，另须提供: 
     - 租户身分证明文件副本 
     - 已公证的租约副本 

应付费用 (根据所申请的订定功率收取): 
电缆接驳费按金

所需时间：
1. 咨询供电可行性：10个工作天内
2. 电表安装：客户及澳电工程完成及验收后，4个工作天内完成

备注：
[1] 如申请人未能亲身办理申请，可签署授权书以委托他人代办。 
[2] 由于建筑物原电力设计未有预留任何电量予停车位，建议私人停车位充电设施的订定功率为6.9千伏安。 
[3] 澳门居民身份证、香港居民身份证、中华人民共和国居民身份证或各国护照。 
[4] 如申请人为公司/社团，须提供最近三个月发出的公司商业/社团登记副本及其电能供应合约须由法定代表人签署。 
[5] 如最近三个月发出的查屋纸仍未更改为新的业权人，客户可再递交经律师见证的买卖楼宇合约／银行三方约／屋契／物业转移税单（M1&M2）副本作参考，但需审批。

以上信息对用户有实际参考价值。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/applyev/request-power-for-private-ev-charging/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/applyev/request-power-for-private-ev-charging/"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "A组收费
A4 社会援助收费
申请条件：
•   凡被澳门社会工作局列入社会援助计划的住宅客户，其订定功率在6.9千伏安以下及最近6个月内的每月耗电量在120度或以下；
•   需提供由澳门社会工作局发出的有效社会援助卡；
•   一经申请，若客户符合上述的耗电量要求，本公司将自动以此项收费计算。

价格
订定功率, 功率费, 电能费用
至6.9千伏安, 0.0(澳门币), 0.429(澳门币/度)

电费单范例, 单位, 单位价格, 金额(澳门币)
电费, 100, 0.429, 42.90
收费调整系数, 100, 0.26, 26.00
政府税(0.75x √3.4), , , 1.40
合共, , , 70.30
",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/uploads/pdf_education_Tariff_A_zh_881af653dd.pdf",
        "topic": "A组A4社会援助收费条件以及具体费用"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "社援收费申请条件：凡被澳门社会工作局列入社会援助计划的住宅客户，其订定功率在6.9千伏安以下，且最近6个月内的每月耗电量在120度或以下。申请人需提供由澳门社会工作局发出的有效社会援助卡。若符合上述条件，本公司将在申请后自动按此项收费计算。

价格：
- 订定功率功率费用为：至6.9千伏安时，功率费用为0澳门元，电能费用为0.429澳门元/度。

电费单范例：
- 电费为100度，电能费用为0.429澳门元/度，总金额为42.90澳门元。
- 收费调整系数为100度，调整费用为0.340澳门元/度，总金额为34.00澳门元。
- 政府税按公式0.75 x √6.9计算，税额为2.00澳门元。
- 最终合计金额为78.90澳门元。

备注：根据2022年6月27日第25/2022号行政法规则和第105/2022号行政长官批示。
",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billpaymentpromotion/social-tariff/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billpaymentpromotion/social-tariff/"
    }
}

entities.description: This category includes various application forms and declarations related to electricity services provided by CEM.
The Power Installation Use Declaration is a document required for non-residential electricity applications.
Billing Procedures outline the methods and timelines for charging Customers for their electricity consumption based on meter readings.
The Billing and Collection Process outlines the procedures for issuing bills and collecting payments for electricity services.
The Correction Process outlines the steps taken by the Company to rectify errors in energy metering and billing, including customer notifications and adjustments.
Electric lines are the infrastructure necessary for connecting the Customer's installation to the low or medium-voltage network, which the Company is responsible for installing.
Regulations refer to the rules and standards that govern the supply of electricity and the responsibilities of both The Company and the Customer.
The Electricity Billing System refers to the procedures and regulations governing the billing and collection of electricity consumption.
Technical Rules are guidelines that must be followed by the Customer when operating private electricity generation equipment.

query: 付款方法澳電櫃檯支持哪些電費支付方式？
response:
### 澳电柜台电费支付方式

澳电柜台支持多种电费支付方式，包括现金、支票和自动转账。客户可以亲临澳门电力公司大楼的柜台进行这些支付。此外，柜台支付地点为澳门马交石炮台马路电力公司大楼，服务时间为周一至周五上午九时至下午五时四十五分。

**
answer:
### 付款方法

澳电柜台支持多种电费支付方式，包括现金、支票和电子支付等。具体支付方式及相关手续费可在柜台查询。 

####

17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

    "page_content": "89Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
23.3 When suspicion of fraudulent procedure arises, the Company shall 
request the presence of two witnesses, duly credentialed by competent 
authorities, to confirm or deny the existence of fraud.
23.4 When the existence of fraud is confirmed and imputable to the 
Customer, the Company reserves the right:
a) To be reimbursed for the amount corresponding to energy 
illicitly consumed and of any expenses related to the 
elimination of the fraud, namely the repair or replacement 
of damaged equipment;
b) To withhold supply until full payment is made of the amount 
due according to the previous subparagraph.
24. Value of energy illicitly consumed  (24)
24.1 The value of the energy illicitly consumed is computed by the 
Company, based on the highest tariff set for the subgroup contracted 
by the Customer, plus 25%, taking into account all the facts relevant 
to the computation of real consumption during the period wherein 
the fraudulent procedure took place, namely the characteristics of the 
installation, its schedule of operation, previous readings, if any, and 
posterior readings, if necessary.
24.2 When there are no elements to allow an objective computation of 
energy illicitly consumed, the relevant value is computed using the 
following rules:
a) Low-voltage Customers
Pc up to 20.7 kV A ................. 50-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 34.5kV A to 69 kV ..... 70-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 100 kV A to 340 kV A .100-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc above 340 kV A ........... 200-hour monthly usage of Pc
b) Medium-voltage Customers .... 300-hour monthly usage of Pc
Whereof “Pc” is the demand subscribed by the Customer
24.3 Estimation performed in the terms of the previous paragraph 
comprises the period in relation thereto proof was presented wherein 
such irregular consumption was maintained or, if such evidence does 
not exist, a period of thirty-six months.",

15.9 Notices of supply interruption shall contain a warning of live 
installations.
16. Suspension of supply  (16)
16.1 The Company may suspend the supply of electricity when any of the 
following events imputable to the Customer occur:
a) Noncompliance with provisions that aim to eliminate 
any type of disruption to network operation and other 
installations, as well as in concern to the safety of persons 
and property;
b) Impossibility to read meters as covered by clause 17 
hereof;
c) Opposition to inspection of installations within the 
appointed schedule;
d) Failure to pay bills for energy consumption and demand, as 
well as any additional charges and services, within the term 
provided;
e) Fraud, as provided under paragraph 23.4;
f) Failure to update the guarantee within the term provided 
after being served notice to that effect by the Company;
g) In the situation provided under paragraph 9.4;
h) Failure to regularize default situations provided under 
paragraph 1.4 or clause 22, hereof, within the term provided 
to that effect by the Company.
16.2 Interruption of supply in situation provided under the previous 
paragraph shall not exempt the Customer from possible civil or 
criminal liability.
16.3 In the case provided under subparagraph 16.1 d), the Company 
reserves the right to withhold reconnection from the Customer until 
all outstanding bills are paid and, if necessary, the guarantee referred 
to under clause 4, hereof duly replenished, wherefore reconnection is 
subject to the payment of a charge in the terms of the Law.",

{
    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

    "page_content": "** 一站式中小企电力支援服务 **
澳电全力支持澳门特区政府对旧城区的活化改造倡议，并已作好准备推出一站式中小企电力支援服务，协助改善区内的营商环境，满足不同的用电需求。
专人跟进
专人跟进进度，适时提供协助，提高效率。客户亦可随时透过澳电APP追踪申请进度。
如欲申请电力供应、合约转名或加大/减细电表，可于澳电网上服务办理，或致电专线：2833 9930、特设电邮地址sme.supports@cem-macau.com 与我们联络。

电力技术咨询服务
根据商户的店铺大小及业务性质等，为客户提供精准用电需求评估及分析，避免申请过多用电量。
即时电力评估

完善的电业承办商名单
客户可于澳电网站选择合适的注册电业承办商施工，保障工程质量及缩短工期。
电业承办商名单",

                        非繁忙时间(13个小时)20:00–09:00    1.420
中速（高于7.4千瓦，但不高于25千瓦）        全日24小时          2.980

    "page_content": "1. 联系电话：如需更新任何个人资料，用户需致电2833 9911与澳电客户联系中心客户服务主任联络。

2. 电动汽车充电站的使用条款说明：
   - 在澳门特区政府的同意下，澳电在澳门提供充电站供电动汽车使用。
   - 如发现充电站出现任何损坏或操作失灵，请即时停止使用该设施及充电服务。
   - 用户对正确使用电动汽车充电站负有责任，必须按照《如何充电》中的指引使用充电站。
   - 充电进行期间，切勿直接从车辆拔除充电连接器。如需终止充电，必须依照“停止充电”之程序。

3. 电动汽车充电费用支付服务：
   - 用户可通过电子钱包内余额或以信用卡或银联无感支付授权金额作一次性支付。

4. 电动汽车充电收费的具体规定：
   - 充电收费按照充电速度以每度电计算，具体收费如下：
     - 慢速：按时段收费，分为繁忙时间（09:00 至20:00）及非繁忙时间（20:00 至09:00）两种收费。
     - 中速：全日24小时划一收费。
     - 快速：全日24小时划一收费。

5. 入驻和注册有关的信息：未得澳电书面授权，任何人士均不可重新分配或复制本网站的一切资料。

    "page_content": "
了解我的账单

1. 合约号：当查询供电事宜或账单时，请提供此号码。
2. 应付总金额：应缴费用的总数。
3. 到期付款日：客户须于此日期或之前缴付电费。若逾期缴费，将在下月账单内征收逾期附加费。
4. 自动转账资料（只适用于自动转账客户）：此栏印有自动转账的银行名称及过数日期。
5. 下月抄表日期：安排于此日期抄读用电度数。
6. 用电时期：上月抄表日期至本月抄表日期及之间的用电天数。
7. 用电量（度）：将本月读数与上月读数相减，再乘以乘数值。
8. 按金：按订定功率值（电表大小）计算，用以保证客户依时缴付所有电费。
9. 收费调整系数：按季度调整以反映电力生产和购买之成本上的浮动。
10. 政府税：就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/understand-my-bill/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/understand-my-bill/"
    }
}

Online Services allow customers to manage their electricity accounts, track application progress, and make inquiries.

relationships.description: The Customer's Electricity Consumption is monitored and billed by the Company based on usage over time.
The Meter Reading is conducted to assess the Customer's electricity consumption for billing purposes.
The Customer benefits from Billing Corrections, which ensure they are charged accurately for their energy consumption.
The Customer is billed according to the Tariff set by the Company based on their energy consumption subgroup.
Outstanding Bills must be paid by the Customer to avoid suspension of electricity supply by The Company.
The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.
The Company bills customers based on their electricity consumption, which is measured monthly.
The Company operates within the Electricity Billing System to manage billing and collection of electricity consumption from customers.

query: 如何繳付我的賬單？
response:
### 如何缴付我的账单？

您可以通过多种方式缴付电费，包括电子支付、自动转账、网上银行、自动柜员机、电话理财、支票和柜台缴费。电子支付支持普通及过期账单，且部分银行提供免费服务。柜台缴费则需亲临澳门电力公司办事处进行。具体的收费方式及服务介绍，请参考相关资料。

**
answer: 您可以透過以下支付方式繳付電費：自動轉賬電子支付：與澳電合作的各個電子支付平台服務櫃檯：澳電大樓、澳門自來水、郵局、7-11 便利店、OK便利店 網上銀行電話理財自動櫃員機澳電大樓入口的支票通郵寄支票中國電信(澳門)的微信公眾號 中國電信(澳門)的自助服務機 也可按這裏得到更多繳費方面的資訊。

{
    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

{
    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

        "producer": "Acrobat Distiller 8.1.0 (Macintosh)",

{
    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

{
    "page_content": "1. 联系电话：如需更新任何个人资料，用户需致电2833 9911与澳电客户联系中心客户服务主任联络。

2. 电动汽车充电站的使用条款说明：
   - 在澳门特区政府的同意下，澳电在澳门提供充电站供电动汽车使用。
   - 如发现充电站出现任何损坏或操作失灵，请即时停止使用该设施及充电服务。
   - 用户对正确使用电动汽车充电站负有责任，必须按照《如何充电》中的指引使用充电站。
   - 充电进行期间，切勿直接从车辆拔除充电连接器。如需终止充电，必须依照“停止充电”之程序。

3. 电动汽车充电费用支付服务：
   - 用户可通过电子钱包内余额或以信用卡或银联无感支付授权金额作一次性支付。

4. 电动汽车充电收费的具体规定：
   - 充电收费按照充电速度以每度电计算，具体收费如下：
     - 慢速：按时段收费，分为繁忙时间（09:00 至20:00）及非繁忙时间（20:00 至09:00）两种收费。
     - 中速：全日24小时划一收费。
     - 快速：全日24小时划一收费。

5. 入驻和注册有关的信息：未得澳电书面授权，任何人士均不可重新分配或复制本网站的一切资料。

Sale of Electricity
17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

{
    "page_content": "89Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
23.3 When suspicion of fraudulent procedure arises, the Company shall 
request the presence of two witnesses, duly credentialed by competent 
authorities, to confirm or deny the existence of fraud.
23.4 When the existence of fraud is confirmed and imputable to the 
Customer, the Company reserves the right:
a) To be reimbursed for the amount corresponding to energy 
illicitly consumed and of any expenses related to the 
elimination of the fraud, namely the repair or replacement 
of damaged equipment;
b) To withhold supply until full payment is made of the amount 
due according to the previous subparagraph.
24. Value of energy illicitly consumed  (24)
24.1 The value of the energy illicitly consumed is computed by the 
Company, based on the highest tariff set for the subgroup contracted 
by the Customer, plus 25%, taking into account all the facts relevant 
to the computation of real consumption during the period wherein 
the fraudulent procedure took place, namely the characteristics of the 
installation, its schedule of operation, previous readings, if any, and 
posterior readings, if necessary.
24.2 When there are no elements to allow an objective computation of 
energy illicitly consumed, the relevant value is computed using the 
following rules:
a) Low-voltage Customers
Pc up to 20.7 kV A ................. 50-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 34.5kV A to 69 kV ..... 70-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 100 kV A to 340 kV A .100-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc above 340 kV A ........... 200-hour monthly usage of Pc
b) Medium-voltage Customers .... 300-hour monthly usage of Pc
Whereof “Pc” is the demand subscribed by the Customer
24.3 Estimation performed in the terms of the previous paragraph 
comprises the period in relation thereto proof was presented wherein 
such irregular consumption was maintained or, if such evidence does 
not exist, a period of thirty-six months.",

有关之电能供应合约已终止及申请人名下单位没有任何尚未

9. Transfer of contract or Customer’s name change (9)
9.1 The Customer is obliged to inform the Company, within a period of 
fifteen days, of any alteration to the respective name, firm or company 
name.
9.2 A Customer who, by any means, shall transfer or assign the operation 
of its premises is obliged to inform the Company of the name and 
address or registered office of the new Customer, otherwise he/she 
shall remain liable for all debits of the Customer until the date when 
such information is served to the Company.
9.3 In the case of transfer, the relevant deed must specify that the transferee 
agrees to comply with the contractual clauses and obligations 
undertaken by the transferor, wherefore, in case of non-specification, 
the simple continuance of the operation is deemed acknowledgment 
of such obligations on the part of the transferee.
9.4 In the case hereinbefore provided, the transferee may be required 
to sign another contract within fifteen days after notification to that 
effect by the Company.
10. Termination of contract (10)
 Notwithstanding any other grounds provided by Law, both parties 
may rescind the contract on the following grounds:
10.1 On the part of the Customer, if the concession has been suspended by 
reason of force majeure and the Company fails to retake the service 
after the end of such force majeure.",

entities.description: Billing Errors are mistakes in the invoicing process that can lead to incorrect charges for energy consumption.
电子支付encompasses various electronic methods for paying bills, including online banking and mobile payments.
Cash Payment is a method of providing a guarantee by the Customer for electricity supply contracts, ensuring immediate availability of funds.
Online Services allow customers to manage their electricity accounts, track application progress, and make inquiries.
无感支付refers to a payment method that allows for automatic payment once pre-registered.

信用卡is a payment method that users can use for one-time payments for electric vehicle charging services.<SEP>信用卡refers to a payment method that allows users to pay for charging services in a one-time transaction.
Billing Procedures outline the methods and timelines for charging Customers for their electricity consumption based on meter readings.
支票is a traditional payment method where customers can send checks to pay their electricity bills.
电费缴交refers to the various methods available for paying electricity bills in Macau.

The电子钱包is a digital payment method that users can utilize to pay for charging services at the electric vehicle charging stations.<SEP>电子钱包refers to a digital wallet that users can use to maintain a balance for charging services.
银联无感支付is a contactless payment method that allows users to pay for charging services seamlessly.

relationships.description: Billing errors directly affect the Customer's financial obligations and require resolution by the Company.
The Company implements the Billing and Collection Process to manage how bills are issued and payments are collected.
电子支付is another method available under电费缴交for customers to pay their bills electronically.
自动转账is one of the methods included in电费缴交for paying electricity bills.
建设银行offers free services for paying electricity bills, contributing to电费缴交.
中国银行offers services that allow customers to pay their electricity bills as part of电费缴交.
一户通facilitates various utility payments, including electricity bills, under电费缴交.
极易付offers convenient options for paying electricity bills included in电费缴交.
立桥银行provides free bill payment services for electricity, contributing to电费缴交.
南光通provides easy payment options for electricity bills as part of电费缴交.
Online Services are part of澳电's offerings, allowing customers to manage their accounts and track applications online.
The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.

relationships.entity1: 澳门电力股份有限公司
relationships.description: 电费缴交outlines the various payment methods offered by澳门电力股份有限公司for electricity bills.
工银澳门offers free services for electricity bill payments, included in电费缴交.
自助服务机provides an electronic option for customers to pay their electricity bills as part of电费缴交.
澳门钱包allows users to pay their electricity bills electronically as part of电费缴交.
The Customer is billed according to the Tariff set by the Company based on their energy consumption subgroup.
The Customer benefits from Billing Corrections, which ensure they are charged accurately for their energy consumption.
The Company operates within the Electricity Billing System to manage billing and collection of electricity consumption from customers.
柜台缴费is a traditional method of payment included in电费缴交for customers who prefer in-person transactions.
The Customer remains liable for all debits until the Company is informed of any changes, indicating a financial responsibility relationship.
The Company issues a Credit Note to the Customer when overbilling occurs, allowing for adjustments in future payments.

augmented_query: How can I pay my bill online? What payment methods are accepted for my bill?

query: 我在離澳期間如何繳付電費？
response:
### 如何在离澳期间缴付电费

您可以通过多种方式在离澳期间缴付电费，包括电子支付、网上银行、自助服务机、以及通过银行的柜台服务。例如，澳门电力股份有限公司提供的网上服务和电子钱包都可以用于支付电费。此外，自动转账也是一个方便的选择，您只需在出发前设置好相关申请即可。
answer: 您可預先申請自動轉賬服務，或者透過與澳電合作的各個電子支付平台，隨時隨地使用手機應用程式繳費。此外，您亦可透過澳電網上服務、澳電APP或南光通預繳電費。

{
    "page_content": "** 一站式中小企电力支援服务 **
澳电全力支持澳门特区政府对旧城区的活化改造倡议，并已作好准备推出一站式中小企电力支援服务，协助改善区内的营商环境，满足不同的用电需求。
专人跟进
专人跟进进度，适时提供协助，提高效率。客户亦可随时透过澳电APP追踪申请进度。
如欲申请电力供应、合约转名或加大/减细电表，可于澳电网上服务办理，或致电专线：2833 9930、特设电邮地址sme.supports@cem-macau.com 与我们联络。

电力技术咨询服务
根据商户的店铺大小及业务性质等，为客户提供精准用电需求评估及分析，避免申请过多用电量。
即时电力评估

完善的电业承办商名单
客户可于澳电网站选择合适的注册电业承办商施工，保障工程质量及缩短工期。

{
    "page_content": "1. 联系电话：如需更新任何个人资料，用户需致电2833 9911与澳电客户联系中心客户服务主任联络。

2. 电动汽车充电站的使用条款说明：
   - 在澳门特区政府的同意下，澳电在澳门提供充电站供电动汽车使用。
   - 如发现充电站出现任何损坏或操作失灵，请即时停止使用该设施及充电服务。
   - 用户对正确使用电动汽车充电站负有责任，必须按照《如何充电》中的指引使用充电站。
   - 充电进行期间，切勿直接从车辆拔除充电连接器。如需终止充电，必须依照“停止充电”之程序。

3. 电动汽车充电费用支付服务：
   - 用户可通过电子钱包内余额或以信用卡或银联无感支付授权金额作一次性支付。

4. 电动汽车充电收费的具体规定：
   - 充电收费按照充电速度以每度电计算，具体收费如下：
     - 慢速：按时段收费，分为繁忙时间（09:00 至20:00）及非繁忙时间（20:00 至09:00）两种收费。
     - 中速：全日24小时划一收费。
     - 快速：全日24小时划一收费。

5. 入驻和注册有关的信息：未得澳电书面授权，任何人士均不可重新分配或复制本网站的一切资料。
",

    }
}

{
    "page_content": "
1. 个人资料处理声明  
   - 澳电依据澳门第8/2005号《个人资料保护法》处理个人资料，资料包括姓名、地址、电话号码、电表号、身份证号码、电邮等。

2. 资料收集来源  
   - 来自用户主动提供、业务过程中产生的信息及其他合法途径。

3. 资料使用目的  
   - 提供及维护电力服务  
   - 账单处理与支付  
   - 客户服务与沟通  
   - 市场推广及宣传  
   - 法律合规及风险管理

4. 资料保护原则  
   - 只收集必要资料  
   - 资料安全保护，防止未经授权访问  
   - 未经同意不会披露给第三方，除非法律要求或合作提供服务

5. 资料保留期限  
   - 仅在达成目的期间保留，之后删除或匿名化处理

6. 用户权利  
   - 查阅、更正、删除个人资料  
   - 随时取消直销推广资料接收

7. 身份验证  
   - 核实用户身份后处理相关请求

8. 投诉渠道  
   - 用户可向澳门个人资料保护办公室投诉

9. 联系方式  
   - 联系电邮：customer.centre@cem-macau.com  
   - 通讯地址：澳门马交石炮台马路澳电大楼

10. 声明更新  
    - 隐私声明可能不时更新，最新版本公布于官网

",
