15.9 Notices of supply interruption shall contain a warning of live 
installations.
16. Suspension of supply  (16)
16.1 The Company may suspend the supply of electricity when any of the 
following events imputable to the Customer occur:
a) Noncompliance with provisions that aim to eliminate 
any type of disruption to network operation and other 
installations, as well as in concern to the safety of persons 
and property;
b) Impossibility to read meters as covered by clause 17 
hereof;
c) Opposition to inspection of installations within the 
appointed schedule;
d) Failure to pay bills for energy consumption and demand, as 
well as any additional charges and services, within the term 
provided;
e) Fraud, as provided under paragraph 23.4;
f) Failure to update the guarantee within the term provided 
after being served notice to that effect by the Company;
g) In the situation provided under paragraph 9.4;
h) Failure to regularize default situations provided under 
paragraph 1.4 or clause 22, hereof, within the term provided 
to that effect by the Company.
16.2 Interruption of supply in situation provided under the previous 
paragraph shall not exempt the Customer from possible civil or 
criminal liability.
16.3 In the case provided under subparagraph 16.1 d), the Company 
reserves the right to withhold reconnection from the Customer until 
all outstanding bills are paid and, if necessary, the guarantee referred 
to under clause 4, hereof duly replenished, wherefore reconnection is 
subject to the payment of a charge in the terms of the Law.",

功率费+【电能费用 + 【政府税 + 收费调整系数】 】
功率费
按用户选择使用的充电设备预设的额定最大输出功率计算。目前不收取相关费用。
充电量

{
    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

entities.entity: 澳门电力股份有限公司
entities.description: 澳门电力股份有限公司(澳电) is a company that oversees the electrical supply in Macau and is responsible for the skills certification program for electrical engineering personnel.<SEP>澳门电力股份有限公司is the electric utility company in Macau responsible for electricity supply and billing services.
电费缴交refers to the various methods available for paying electricity bills in Macau.
一户通is a service in Macau that facilitates various utility payments, including electricity.
电子支付encompasses various electronic methods for paying bills, including online banking and mobile payments.
大西洋银行is a bank in Macau that provides banking services, including free bill payment options.
建设银行is a bank in Macau that offers free services for electricity bill payments.
自动转账is a payment method that allows automatic deduction of electricity bills from a bank account.
中国银行is a bank in Macau that offers various financial services, including bill payment options.
立桥银行is a bank in Macau that offers free bill payment services for electricity.
澳电微信是澳电提供的服务平台，客户可以通过该平台接收电子账单。
澳电APP is a mobile application that allows customers to track their application progress for electricity services.<SEP>澳电APP是澳电的移动应用程序，客户可以通过该应用接收电子账单和管理账户。
手机推送通知是通过澳电微信或澳电APP接收电子账单的方式。
工银澳门is a bank in Macau that offers free services for paying electricity bills.<SEP>工银澳门是澳门的一家银行，提供客户打印纸质账单的服务。
澳门钱包is a digital wallet service in Macau that allows users to make payments, including electricity bills.

信用卡is a payment method that users can use for one-time payments for electric vehicle charging services.<SEP>信用卡refers to a payment method that allows users to pay for charging services in a one-time transaction.
Online Services allow customers to manage their electricity accounts, track application progress, and make inquiries.

The电子钱包is a digital payment method that users can utilize to pay for charging services at the electric vehicle charging stations.<SEP>电子钱包refers to a digital wallet that users can use to maintain a balance for charging services.
Cash Payment is a method of providing a guarantee by the Customer for electricity supply contracts, ensuring immediate availability of funds.
银联无感支付is a contactless payment method that allows users to pay for charging services seamlessly.

query: 如何繳付共同分擔費用(電纜接駁費)/工程費用?
response:
### 如何缴付共同分担费用（电缆接驳费）/工程费用

共同分担费用（如电缆接驳费）及工程费用一般需在合同签订后按照约定支付。具体支付方式可能包括现金、银行转账或其他合法支付手段。请参阅供电指南中的相关指导，以确保所有要求和程序得到满足。
answer: 根據澳電的規定，申請人在提交工程更改或電力設備安裝的同時，需支付這些費用，並遵循相關的申請流程及條件。具體的付款細節和要求可參考澳電的官方網站或聯絡客服了解更多資訊。

Sale of Electricity
17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

{
    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

{
    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

15.9 Notices of supply interruption shall contain a warning of live 
installations.
16. Suspension of supply  (16)
16.1 The Company may suspend the supply of electricity when any of the 
following events imputable to the Customer occur:
a) Noncompliance with provisions that aim to eliminate 
any type of disruption to network operation and other 
installations, as well as in concern to the safety of persons 
and property;
b) Impossibility to read meters as covered by clause 17 
hereof;
c) Opposition to inspection of installations within the 
appointed schedule;
d) Failure to pay bills for energy consumption and demand, as 
well as any additional charges and services, within the term 
provided;
e) Fraud, as provided under paragraph 23.4;
f) Failure to update the guarantee within the term provided 
after being served notice to that effect by the Company;
g) In the situation provided under paragraph 9.4;
h) Failure to regularize default situations provided under 
paragraph 1.4 or clause 22, hereof, within the term provided 
to that effect by the Company.
16.2 Interruption of supply in situation provided under the previous 
paragraph shall not exempt the Customer from possible civil or 
criminal liability.
16.3 In the case provided under subparagraph 16.1 d), the Company 
reserves the right to withhold reconnection from the Customer until 
all outstanding bills are paid and, if necessary, the guarantee referred 
to under clause 4, hereof duly replenished, wherefore reconnection is 
subject to the payment of a charge in the terms of the Law.",

{
    "page_content": "
了解我的账单

1. 合约号：当查询供电事宜或账单时，请提供此号码。
2. 应付总金额：应缴费用的总数。
3. 到期付款日：客户须于此日期或之前缴付电费。若逾期缴费，将在下月账单内征收逾期附加费。
4. 自动转账资料（只适用于自动转账客户）：此栏印有自动转账的银行名称及过数日期。
5. 下月抄表日期：安排于此日期抄读用电度数。
6. 用电时期：上月抄表日期至本月抄表日期及之间的用电天数。
7. 用电量（度）：将本月读数与上月读数相减，再乘以乘数值。
8. 按金：按订定功率值（电表大小）计算，用以保证客户依时缴付所有电费。
9. 收费调整系数：按季度调整以反映电力生产和购买之成本上的浮动。
10. 政府税：就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。",

    }
}

{
    "page_content": "供电条件规范 - 摘要  
合约的范围澳电将按照所有规章及客户所定的功率供应电力。   
合约的条件  
2.1 供电合约的有效期为一个月，得以相同期限自动续期。  
2.2 如客户欲取消合约，应最少提前五个工作日书面通知澳电，并负责缴清所有关于用电量及功率的欠款。   

供应电力的可靠性及中断  
3.1 电力的供应是不间断和持续的，其中断或限制只能因工作理由、意外或不可抗力的原因、事先协议或可归责于客户的行为而发生。  
3.5 凡属计划性停电，澳电需要提前36小时逐一通知客户；若未能逐一通知时，将透过传播媒界通知客户。  

电费  
8.1 电费最迟应于抄表后十五天内在澳电办事处缴付或按账单背面所指的方式透过指定机构缴付。  
8.2 如截至载于账单上的缴费日期仍未缴费，则须就欠款金额缴付附加费，且可在自上述日期起计五个工作天后被暂停供电。  

按金  
9.1 签约时，澳电有权要求户缴交按金，其全部或部分可用于缴付客户欠缴的部分或全部费用。  
9.3 合约届满时，按金将在扣除客户欠缴的费用后发还。  

投诉及要求  
10.1 澳电欢迎客户透过资询通及/或其他渠道就我们的服务作出要求及/或投诉。  
10.2 客户进行有关账单的投诉时，所有调整中的欠缴费用将暂时无须缴付直至得出调查结果为止。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/about-cem/power-supply-technical-information/standard-condition-of-supply/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/about-cem/power-supply-technical-information/standard-condition-of-supply/"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

{
    "page_content": "1. 联系电话：如需更新任何个人资料，用户需致电2833 9911与澳电客户联系中心客户服务主任联络。

2. 电动汽车充电站的使用条款说明：
   - 在澳门特区政府的同意下，澳电在澳门提供充电站供电动汽车使用。
   - 如发现充电站出现任何损坏或操作失灵，请即时停止使用该设施及充电服务。
   - 用户对正确使用电动汽车充电站负有责任，必须按照《如何充电》中的指引使用充电站。
   - 充电进行期间，切勿直接从车辆拔除充电连接器。如需终止充电，必须依照“停止充电”之程序。

3. 电动汽车充电费用支付服务：
   - 用户可通过电子钱包内余额或以信用卡或银联无感支付授权金额作一次性支付。

4. 电动汽车充电收费的具体规定：
   - 充电收费按照充电速度以每度电计算，具体收费如下：
     - 慢速：按时段收费，分为繁忙时间（09:00 至20:00）及非繁忙时间（20:00 至09:00）两种收费。
     - 中速：全日24小时划一收费。
     - 快速：全日24小时划一收费。

5. 入驻和注册有关的信息：未得澳电书面授权，任何人士均不可重新分配或复制本网站的一切资料。

9. Transfer of contract or Customer’s name change (9)
9.1 The Customer is obliged to inform the Company, within a period of 
fifteen days, of any alteration to the respective name, firm or company 
name.
9.2 A Customer who, by any means, shall transfer or assign the operation 
of its premises is obliged to inform the Company of the name and 
address or registered office of the new Customer, otherwise he/she 
shall remain liable for all debits of the Customer until the date when 
such information is served to the Company.

to sign another contract within fifteen days after notification to that 
effect by the Company.

 Notwithstanding any other grounds provided by Law, both parties 
may rescind the contract on the following grounds:

reason of force majeure and the Company fails to retake the service 
after the end of such force majeure.",

entities.description: Billing Procedures outline the methods and timelines for charging Customers for their electricity consumption based on meter readings.
The Billing and Collection Process outlines the procedures for issuing bills and collecting payments for electricity services.
The Electricity Billing System refers to the procedures and regulations governing the billing and collection of electricity consumption.
账单是电力公司向客户发送的费用清单，详细列出用户的用电量和应支付的电费。
Billing Errors are mistakes in the invoicing process that can lead to incorrect charges for energy consumption.
Outstanding Bills refer to unpaid charges for energy consumption and services that the Customer owes to The Company.
电子支付encompasses various electronic methods for paying bills, including online banking and mobile payments.
Electricity Bill refers to the statement detailing the amount owed for electricity usage, including various charges and due dates.
充电流程describes the steps involved in using public charging services, from account setup to payment.
Costs refer to the financial responsibilities associated with the installation, maintenance, and operation of electrical systems and equipment.
Cash Payment is a method of providing a guarantee by the Customer for electricity supply contracts, ensuring immediate availability of funds.

信用卡is a payment method that users can use for one-time payments for electric vehicle charging services.<SEP>信用卡refers to a payment method that allows users to pay for charging services in a one-time transaction.
A Credit Note is issued by the Company to the Customer in cases of overbilling, allowing for future bill payments or cash refunds.
Contractual Clauses are the specific terms and conditions that govern the agreement between the Customer and the Company.
Terms of Supply encompass the specific obligations and rights of both CEM and the Customer regarding electricity usage.
支票is a traditional payment method where customers can send checks to pay their electricity bills.

relationships.description: 优先缴费及柜台服务is an initiative by澳电to provide priority payment services for specific community members.
The Customer benefits from Billing Corrections, which ensure they are charged accurately for their energy consumption.
Outstanding Bills must be paid by the Customer to avoid suspension of electricity supply by The Company.
Billing errors directly affect the Customer's financial obligations and require resolution by the Company.
The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.
CEM Macau issues the Electricity Bill to customers detailing their electricity usage and charges.
The Company implements Billing Corrections to address any discrepancies found in customer bills due to metering errors.
CEM Macau establishes the charging fees based on power usage and time of day for electric vehicle charging.
政府税是Electricity Bill中包含的费用，客户需按月支付。
电费单范例provides an example of how A组收费is calculated and presented on a bill.
The Customer is responsible for the costs associated with the installation and maintenance of electrical systems and equipment.
Debits Due represent the amounts the Customer must pay to the Company following corrections to their billing.
客户may be required to pay an按金when signing the contract, which can be used to cover any unpaid bills.
The Company implements the Billing and Collection Process to manage how bills are issued and payments are collected.
按金may be required as part of the application process as outlined in the供电指南.
建设银行offers free services for paying electricity bills, contributing to电费缴交.
自动转账is one of the methods included in电费缴交for paying electricity bills.
自动转账资料帮助客户管理Electricity Bill的支付方式。
澳电提供电子账单服务，允许客户选择以电子方式接收账单。
The Contract is established between the Company and the Customer, outlining their mutual obligations and guarantees.
The Customer remains liable for all debits until the Company is informed of any changes, indicating a financial responsibility relationship.
The Company enforces the contractual clauses that govern the relationship with the Customer, indicating a regulatory role.
The Company issues a Credit Note to the Customer when overbilling occurs, allowing for adjustments in future payments.
电子支付is another method available under电费缴交for customers to pay their bills electronically.
支票is a method of payment that falls under the category of电费缴交for settling electricity bills.
Contract Type is a component of the Electricity Supply Contract, outlining the nature of the agreement.

augmented_query: How do I make a payment for shared connection costs related to cable installations? What are the payment methods available for engineering fees?

query: 如果我申請終止合約/轉名，政府電費補貼所剩餘之款項可否轉移給我名下其他的合同？
response:
### 终止合约/转名及政府电费补贴

根据规定，终止合约或转名后，未使用的电费补贴余额将在2023年5月后自动注销，因此这些款项不能转移到您名下其他合同。请注意，如果在补贴使用期限内取消供电合约或更改供电合约名称，累积未使用的补贴余额也将全数注销。
answer: 不可。累積金額是不可退還，亦不得轉讓。即使終止合約/轉名時仍有餘款，亦不得轉至其他合約，只會呈報政府。

{
    "page_content": "71Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
3. Signing terms  (3)
3.1 The supply contract shall only be signed between the Company and 
any person who is capable of showing, with probity, to hold due rights 
or possession, in its own name or other persons, over the property, or 
any fraction thereof, whereto electricity must be supplied.
3.2 Due rights or possession is deemed as ownership rights, tenancy 
rights, floor leasing and the gratuitous or onerous transfer of the 
property, to be supplied with electricity or any part thereof.
3.3 In the case of gratuitous transfer the holder of such right is obliged 
to show evidence of the legitimacy of such possession by means of a 
declaration signed by the grantor of the gratuitous transfer and duly 
certified in the terms of the Law.
3.4 The Customer shall only be able to sign a new supply contract after 
full settlement of any overdue debts with the Company.
4. Guarantee (Deposit)  (4)
4.1 The Company reserves the right to demand from the Customer, 
simultaneous with the signing of the contract, as a precondition to 
start the supply of electricity, a guarantee, the amount and specific 
regulations of which shall be set by the Macau Special Administrative 
Region.
4.2 The guarantee hereinbefore mentioned is to be used as security for 
the payment of any debt of the Customer with the Company, but does 
not imply any limit to the liability of the former before the latter.
4.3 A guarantee which has been deposited in cash shall be refunded in the 
term of the supply contract or any extensions thereto, after deduction 
of any debit due by the Customer to the Company, and shall revert in 
favor of the latter if not claimed within three years from the date of 
termination of the contract or the last extension thereof.",

    "page_content": "** 一站式中小企电力支援服务 **

专人跟进
专人跟进进度，适时提供协助，提高效率。客户亦可随时透过澳电APP追踪申请进度。
如欲申请电力供应、合约转名或加大/减细电表，可于澳电网上服务办理，或致电专线：2833 9930、特设电邮地址sme.supports@cem-macau.com 与我们联络。

电力技术咨询服务

12.3 The Company shall carry out itself or subcontract the works deemed 
necessary to the setting of electric lines deemed necessary to connect 
the installation of the Customer to the low or medium-voltage 
network, after the payment of due shared costs in the terms of relevant 
legislation.
12.4 When an increase in capacity, whether in low or medium-voltage, may 
result in shared costs, the Company shall only charge the Customer 
the difference between the new costs to be shared and the amount 
corresponding to the capacity for which the connection charge has 
been previously paid.
12.5 The Company is responsible to execute the installation of electric 
lines leading to the pothead, or directly to the main collective 
switchboard or the Customer’s installation, as well as to setup the 
metering system.
12.6 The Customer is responsible to install the pothead supplied by the 
Company, supply and setup all service-entrance lines, main collective 
switchboard, collective lines, collective line distributing boxes, boxes 
for the fixation of metering devices and respective accessories as well 
as service circuit breakers, according to the electric installation design 
approved by the competent authorities and under the inspection of the 
Company.
12.7 When an application for electricity supply or increased capacity cannot 
be performed from existing low-voltage network, the Customer must 
provide a space wherein a transformer substation may be installed, in 
the terms of the concession contract and relevant legislation.
12.8 The Customer is responsible for the civil works necessary to install 
a transformer substation in the space provided under the previous 
paragraph, wherein the supply and fixation of doors, grids, ventilation 
ducts, fans, gutter metal covers and earthing network is included, 
according to the drawings provided by the Company, as well as 
the installation of an automatic fire extinguisher system whenever 
required.",

    "page_content": "73Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
6.3 The validity of special large Customers’ contracts, as well as the 
status of their operation, tariffs and applicable tariff periods as well 
as any other particular provisions shall be established on a case-by-
case basis and shall be covered by the relevant supply contract.
7. Temporary contracts  (7)
7.1 The Company may sign temporary electricity supply contracts for 
non-permanent installations, for a pre-determined limited term, 
provided technical conditions are favorable to that effect and that 
inconvenience to the distribution network may not result therefrom.
7.2 Temporary electricity supply contracts imply the installation of 
provisional branch lines.
8. Contractual term  (8)
8.1 Ordinary electricity supply contracts are signed for an initial term of 
one month, automatically and successively renewable for the same 
period, notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph 8.3 hereof.
8.2 Temporary contracts have a limited term, wherefore the beginning 
and the end of their validity is explicitly set in the supply contract.
8.3 The Customer, in written and with a minimum notice of five working 
days, must inform the Company of his/her intention to terminate any 
contract signed under the terms provided in paragraphs 8.1 and 8.2 
hereof, wherefore the Customer shall be liable for any amount due 
until the removal of the meters, which shall be carried out during the 
same period.
8.4 The term for special large customer contracts is specified in the 
respective supply contract pursuant to clause 6 hereof.",

    "page_content": "88
Final Provisions
22. Private generation  (22)
22.1 A Customer with private electricity generation is allowed to use the 
energy generated by its own plant only in case of emergency and 
limited duration tests, except for specially authorized cases under the 
terms and conditions to be provided in the relevant supply contract.
22.2 The Customer, when signing the electricity supply contract or later, 
upon installation, is obliged to inform the Company, in written, of the 
existence at the premises of its own means of generation.
22.3 Except through written permission from the Company, attached as 
schedule to the relevant electricity supply contract including technical 
rules to be observed, a Customer who owns a private electricity 
generator is not allowed to operate its own plant in parallel with the 
public network.
23. Fraud (23)
23.1 Any fraudulent procedure susceptible to forge the reading of energy 
or the demand, namely the capture of electricity prior (“upstream”) 
to the meter, tampering of meters or demand control devices, as well 
as alterations to safety devices performed through the breaking of the 
seal or lock, is considered a noncompliance of the electricity supply 
contract.
23.2 Any fraudulent procedures detected within an installation that uses 
electricity located inside a residential unit or any other compound or 
location wherein the Customer has exclusive access or subjected to 
the control thereof, is considered, unless otherwise proven, imputable 
to the Customer.",

3. Guarantee update (29)
3.1 When the requested alteration aims to increase the subscribed 
demand, the Company may constraint the efficacy of such contractual 
alteration to the reinforcement of the relevant guarantee, based on the 
general tariff class A1 in effect on the date such reinforcement is 
made.
3.2 When the requested alteration aims to decrease the subscribed 
demand, the Company shall inform the Customer, as the case may be, 
that he may:
a) Opt to receive the difference from the guarantee, in cash 
or in cheque, or clear the same against the payment of 
consumption and other charges to be included in subsequent 
bills;
b) Choose to replace the guarantee provided under paragraph 
1.2.
3.3 Provided there is no increase to subscribed demand, no update of 
guarantee shall be required from Customers who change tariff rate or 
if being signers of more than a contract for the same building, change 
the number of such contracts.
4. Lapse of the guarantee  (30)
4.1 The lapse of a contract implies the obligation of the Company to 
reimburse the Customer of the amount equal to the guarantee, with 
deduction of any amount eventually due.
4.2 When the guarantee is granted through any of the methods provided 
under paragraph 1.2 hereof and there is no amount due, the lapse of

{
    "page_content": "2022电费补贴措施

澳电全力配合澳门特区政府推出的2022电费补贴纾困措施，是次补贴分「家居」（住宅）及「企业商号」两个类别，分别为每月300澳门元及3,000澳门元，补贴发放时期均为2022年6月至11月的发单月份，合共6个月，发放期间未使用之补贴可于2022年12月至2023年5月的发单月份内以相同每月上限使用。

于补贴使用期限后，倘若尚有未使用的电费补贴余额，则会全数自动注销。此外，期间若取消供电合约或更改供电合约名称，累积未使用的电费补贴余额亦将全数自动注销。

「2022家居及企业商号电费补贴措施」合共超过27万客户受惠，覆盖达98%总用户。受惠的住宅客户为现时享有每月200澳门元「政府电费补贴」的用户，是次补贴措施将会每月补贴每户300澳门元，补贴范围包括支付该月电费，即功率费、电费、收费调整系数及政府税四项，其他费用如逾期附加费等不属补贴范围。

补贴扣减次序为1) 当月200澳门元「政府电费补贴」、2) 300澳门元「2022家居电费补贴措施」。而企业商号方面，除娱乐场、三星或以上酒店场所，以及政府部门的电力供应合约外，其余所有企业商号均能受惠，是次补贴措施将会每月补贴每户3,000澳门元，A组的补贴范围包括支付该月电费，即功率费、电费、收费调整系数及政府税四项；而B组及C组则包括功率费、有功及无功电能、收费调整系数及政府税。

补贴扣减次序为1) 豁免无功电能费用（如有）、2) 支持霓虹招牌用电计划（如有）、3) 3,000澳门元「2022企业商号电费补贴措施」。由于以「发单月」计算补贴期限，故每户每月的补贴起始日均不同，并不是一致地由每月的第1日开始计算。此外，由于每月补贴用以支付该月的电费，请市民避免估算账单；如收到估算账单，可联络澳电自报读数或预约抄表，以实际用电量调整有关电费补贴。

补贴金额将在账单内以「2022家居电费补贴措施」及「2022企业商号电费补贴措施」标示，请市民留意。澳电已就相关补贴的各项细节安排做好准备，亦呼吁市民继续保持良好用电习惯，切勿浪费能源。澳电已就「2022家居及企业商号电费补贴措施」等制成图文包并上传至澳电Facebook专页及微信，常见问题集亦上载于澳电网站www.cem-macau.com，欢迎市民下载及转发。

如有疑问，请致电资询通2833 9911或于澳电微信或网站内向「聊天机械人」查询。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/subsidy/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/subsidy/"
    }
}

9. Transfer of contract or Customer’s name change (9)
9.1 The Customer is obliged to inform the Company, within a period of 
fifteen days, of any alteration to the respective name, firm or company 
name.
9.2 A Customer who, by any means, shall transfer or assign the operation 
of its premises is obliged to inform the Company of the name and 
address or registered office of the new Customer, otherwise he/she 
shall remain liable for all debits of the Customer until the date when 
such information is served to the Company.
9.3 In the case of transfer, the relevant deed must specify that the transferee 
agrees to comply with the contractual clauses and obligations 
undertaken by the transferor, wherefore, in case of non-specification, 
the simple continuance of the operation is deemed acknowledgment 
of such obligations on the part of the transferee.
9.4 In the case hereinbefore provided, the transferee may be required 
to sign another contract within fifteen days after notification to that 
effect by the Company.
10. Termination of contract (10)
 Notwithstanding any other grounds provided by Law, both parties 
may rescind the contract on the following grounds:
10.1 On the part of the Customer, if the concession has been suspended by 
reason of force majeure and the Company fails to retake the service 
after the end of such force majeure.",

{
    "page_content": "89Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
23.3 When suspicion of fraudulent procedure arises, the Company shall 
request the presence of two witnesses, duly credentialed by competent 
authorities, to confirm or deny the existence of fraud.
23.4 When the existence of fraud is confirmed and imputable to the 
Customer, the Company reserves the right:
a) To be reimbursed for the amount corresponding to energy 
illicitly consumed and of any expenses related to the 
elimination of the fraud, namely the repair or replacement 
of damaged equipment;
b) To withhold supply until full payment is made of the amount 
due according to the previous subparagraph.
24. Value of energy illicitly consumed  (24)
24.1 The value of the energy illicitly consumed is computed by the 
Company, based on the highest tariff set for the subgroup contracted 
by the Customer, plus 25%, taking into account all the facts relevant 
to the computation of real consumption during the period wherein 
the fraudulent procedure took place, namely the characteristics of the 
installation, its schedule of operation, previous readings, if any, and 
posterior readings, if necessary.
24.2 When there are no elements to allow an objective computation of 
energy illicitly consumed, the relevant value is computed using the 
following rules:
a) Low-voltage Customers
Pc up to 20.7 kV A ................. 50-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 34.5kV A to 69 kV ..... 70-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 100 kV A to 340 kV A .100-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc above 340 kV A ........... 200-hour monthly usage of Pc
b) Medium-voltage Customers .... 300-hour monthly usage of Pc
Whereof “Pc” is the demand subscribed by the Customer
24.3 Estimation performed in the terms of the previous paragraph 
comprises the period in relation thereto proof was presented wherein 
such irregular consumption was maintained or, if such evidence does 
not exist, a period of thirty-six months.",

    "page_content": "A组收费
适用于以低压电网(230/400伏特)供电的客户：
•   其订定功率在69千伏安以下，或
•   其订定功率高于69千伏安，但未被包括在B组及C组收费内。

收费类别
A1 - 一般收费
A2 - 平民收费
A3 - 社会慈善机构收费
A4 - 社会援助收费

收费
A组收费根据下列项目计算：
订定功率2 (以千伏安计算)
•   供电合约所订定的最大电力负荷，由电表规格及其保护设备所控制。
电费 (以千瓦时(度)计算)
•   于用电期间的总耗电量。
收费调整系数
•   收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。
政府税
•   就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。
备注
(1) 86年8月30日之第35/86/M号法令。
(2) 2005年7月18日之第11/2005号行政法规。
(3) 2004年8月9日之第23/2004号行政命令。  
(4) 2007年3月19日之第5/2007号行政法规。
(5) 税项的计算方式按客户电力装置种类而定（住宅、商业或工业）。",

        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/uploads/pdf_education_Tariff_A_zh_881af653dd.pdf",
        "topic": "A组收费方法以及记算"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "A组收费

适用于以低压电网（230/400伏特）供电的客户：其订定功率在69千伏安以下，或其订定功率高于69千伏安，但未被包括在B组及C组收费内。

A组收费根据下列项目计算：
- 订定功率（以千伏安计算）
- 电费（以千瓦时（度）计算）于用电期间的总耗电量。
- 收费调整系数 收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。
- 政府税 就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。

A1 一般收费  
申请条件未符合A2、A3及A4收费条件的A组收费客户。  
价格:  
- 订定功率功率费:至3.4 千伏安 8.224（澳门元）  
- 电能费用: 0.963（澳门元/度）


A2 减低收费  
申请条件于合约上所订功率在6.9千伏安或以下及最近6个月内的每月耗电量在120度或以下的客户。  
价格:  
- 订定功率功率费:至6.9 千伏安 0.00（澳门元）  
- 电能费用: 0.858（澳门元/度）


A3 社福收费  
申请条件在社会福利领域开展非营利且公认为重要的活动的公共或私人实体；需提供由权限主管部门发出的有关从事非牟利及社会活动性质的证明文件。  
价格:  
- 订定功率功率费:至3.4 千伏安 8.224（澳门元）  
- 电能费用: 0.884（澳门元/度）

A4 社援收费  
申请条件凡被澳门社会工作局列入社会援助计划的住宅客户，其订定功率在6.9千伏安或以下及最近6个月内的每月耗电量在120度或以下；需提供由澳门社会工作局发出的有效社会援助卡。  
价格:  
- 订定功率功率费:至6.9千伏安 0.00（澳门元）  
- 电能费用: 0.429（澳门元/度）

备注: [1] 2022年6月27日之第25/2022号行政法规。  
[2] 2022年6月27日之第105/2022号行政长官批示。

{
    "page_content": "社会服务计划于2000年推出，由澳电志愿技工为独居长者、弱势家庭及有特殊需要的人士提供免费安全检查及维修家居电力装置服务。服务范围进一步扩展至仁慈堂盲人重建中心及澳门聋人协会。

向我们转介需要协助的个案，您认识需要我们提供协助的弱势人士吗？请填妥申请表格的所需资料并发送予我们进行审查。查询请致电8393 1206。

申请程序：
- 网上申请：填妥网上申请表格；澳电将联系您确认所有申请资料；在确认申请后，请通过电邮communityprogram@cem-macau.com或传真2871 9687递交受助人的所需文件副本；当确认提交的文件符合资格，我们将安排人员家访受助人家。
- 通过电邮或传真申请：下载并填妥申请表格，连同受助人的所需文件副本电邮至communityprogram@cem-macau.com或传真至2871 9687；当确认提交的文件符合资格，我们将安排人员家访受助人。

所需文件（受助人）：
- 身份证明文件；
- 澳门社会工作局发出的有效受益人卡；
- 最新一期电费单。

注意事项：
- 案件将获独立跟进；
- 澳电保留家居电力装置维修的最终决定权。",

}

    "page_content": "申请人需于停电前最少10个工作天透过此表格向澳电申请。/ Applicant must submit this request dully filled to CEM at least 10 working days before the requested supply suspension date. / O requerente deve enviar este impresso devidamente preenchido à CEM no mínimo 10 dias úteis antes da data solicitada para a suspensão do fornecimento de energia。\n\n澳电可进行停电或复电操作为工作日(只限星期㇐至五，不包括公众假期)的9:30至12:00，及14:30至17:00。/ Applicant must schedule the supply suspension from 9:30 to 12:00 and/or 14:30 to 17:00 during working days (Monday to Friday excluding public holidays). / O requerente deve agendar a suspensão do fornecimento de energia das 9h30 às 12h00 e/ou das 14h30 às 17h00, de Segunda a Sexta-feira (excepto feriados)。\n\n负责电业工程人员需于2个工作天内取得受影响之住户或商户同意于上述时间进行停电，并向澳电提供已张贴停电通告之证明。/ Responsible electrical technician must ensure that affected residential or commercial customers agree with the suspension schedule and have been informed of it at least 2 working days before the planned date. Accordingly, applicant must post an interruption notice on site with proof to CEM。/ O técnico electricista responsável deve garantir que os clientes residenciais ou comerciais afectados concordam com o horário planeado da suspensão de energia e que todos foram informados do mesmo pelo menos 2 dias antes da data planeada. Ao mesmo tempo, o requerente deve afixar um aviso de suspensão de energia no local e mostrá-lo à CEM。\n\n若涉及澳电电网接入点/澳电接入线的更改工作，澳电有权收取相关工程费用。/ If changes to CEM connection point and/or CEM incoming cables are made, CEM reserves the right to charge for the corresponding works。/ Se forem efectuadas alterações ao ponto de ligação da CEM e/ou aos cabos de entrada da CEM, a CEM reserva-se o direito de cobrar pelos respectivos trabalhos。\n\n如以上的资料有任何更改，请联络澳电资询通28339911。/ Please call CEM Info Line 2833 9911 for any further enquiries。/ É favor ligar para a Linha Info da CEM 2833 9911 para quaisquer esclarecimentos。",

查询详情，欢迎致电资询通 2833 9911 。

Application requirements
1 Permanent Macau resident and holder of Senior Citizen Card; 
2 The registered installation address* must be for residential use;
3 Tariff A1 or A2 customer
*Only one installation address can be registered per Senior Citizen Card
Required documents

2 Senior Citizen Card;
3 Evidence or declaration of household address; and
4 Latest electricity bill of declared household address.",

entities.description: The period from December 2022 to May 2023 is when any unused subsidies can be utilized.

augmented_query: Can the remaining government electricity subsidy funds be transferred to another contract under my name after terminating or transferring a contract? What are the eligibility criteria for transferring government electricity subsidy funds to a different account?

query: 政府電費補貼之金額可否用作繳付按金、罰款、接駁費、零數、累積費用等等？
response:
### 政府电费补贴的使用范围

根据2022电费补贴措施，政府电费补贴主要用于支付当月的电费，包括功率费、电费、收费调整系数及政府税等项目。未使用的补贴不能用于缴付按金、罚款、接驳费或其他累积费用，同时，其他费用如逾期附加费等不属补贴范围。补贴的扣减顺序为政府电费补贴和2022家居电费补贴措施。

**
answer: 不可，它只能用來支付「本期費用」（包括功率費、電費、收費調整系數及政府稅）。

docs.content:
{
    "page_content": "2022电费补贴措施

澳电全力配合澳门特区政府推出的2022电费补贴纾困措施，是次补贴分「家居」（住宅）及「企业商号」两个类别，分别为每月300澳门元及3,000澳门元，补贴发放时期均为2022年6月至11月的发单月份，合共6个月，发放期间未使用之补贴可于2022年12月至2023年5月的发单月份内以相同每月上限使用。

于补贴使用期限后，倘若尚有未使用的电费补贴余额，则会全数自动注销。此外，期间若取消供电合约或更改供电合约名称，累积未使用的电费补贴余额亦将全数自动注销。

「2022家居及企业商号电费补贴措施」合共超过27万客户受惠，覆盖达98%总用户。受惠的住宅客户为现时享有每月200澳门元「政府电费补贴」的用户，是次补贴措施将会每月补贴每户300澳门元，补贴范围包括支付该月电费，即功率费、电费、收费调整系数及政府税四项，其他费用如逾期附加费等不属补贴范围。

补贴扣减次序为1) 当月200澳门元「政府电费补贴」、2) 300澳门元「2022家居电费补贴措施」。而企业商号方面，除娱乐场、三星或以上酒店场所，以及政府部门的电力供应合约外，其余所有企业商号均能受惠，是次补贴措施将会每月补贴每户3,000澳门元，A组的补贴范围包括支付该月电费，即功率费、电费、收费调整系数及政府税四项；而B组及C组则包括功率费、有功及无功电能、收费调整系数及政府税。

补贴扣减次序为1) 豁免无功电能费用（如有）、2) 支持霓虹招牌用电计划（如有）、3) 3,000澳门元「2022企业商号电费补贴措施」。由于以「发单月」计算补贴期限，故每户每月的补贴起始日均不同，并不是一致地由每月的第1日开始计算。此外，由于每月补贴用以支付该月的电费，请市民避免估算账单；如收到估算账单，可联络澳电自报读数或预约抄表，以实际用电量调整有关电费补贴。

补贴金额将在账单内以「2022家居电费补贴措施」及「2022企业商号电费补贴措施」标示，请市民留意。澳电已就相关补贴的各项细节安排做好准备，亦呼吁市民继续保持良好用电习惯，切勿浪费能源。澳电已就「2022家居及企业商号电费补贴措施」等制成图文包并上传至澳电Facebook专页及微信，常见问题集亦上载于澳电网站www.cem-macau.com，欢迎市民下载及转发。

如有疑问，请致电资询通2833 9911或于澳电微信或网站内向「聊天机械人」查询。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/subsidy/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/subsidy/"
    }
}

    "page_content": "如新单位/舖位已有电力供应，请申请合约转名 了解更多 立即申请

    "page_content": "A组收费
适用于以低压电网(230/400伏特)供电的客户：
•   其订定功率在69千伏安以下，或
•   其订定功率高于69千伏安，但未被包括在B组及C组收费内。

收费类别
A1 - 一般收费
A2 - 平民收费
A3 - 社会慈善机构收费
A4 - 社会援助收费

收费
A组收费根据下列项目计算：
订定功率2 (以千伏安计算)
•   供电合约所订定的最大电力负荷，由电表规格及其保护设备所控制。
电费 (以千瓦时(度)计算)
•   于用电期间的总耗电量。
收费调整系数
•   收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。
政府税
•   就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。
备注
(1) 86年8月30日之第35/86/M号法令。
(2) 2005年7月18日之第11/2005号行政法规。
(3) 2004年8月9日之第23/2004号行政命令。  
(4) 2007年3月19日之第5/2007号行政法规。
(5) 税项的计算方式按客户电力装置种类而定（住宅、商业或工业）。",

{
    "page_content": "A组收费

适用于以低压电网（230/400伏特）供电的客户：其订定功率在69千伏安以下，或其订定功率高于69千伏安，但未被包括在B组及C组收费内。

A组收费根据下列项目计算：
- 订定功率（以千伏安计算）
- 电费（以千瓦时（度）计算）于用电期间的总耗电量。
- 收费调整系数 收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。
- 政府税 就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。

A1 一般收费  
申请条件未符合A2、A3及A4收费条件的A组收费客户。  
价格:  
- 订定功率功率费:至3.4 千伏安 8.224（澳门元）  
- 电能费用: 0.963（澳门元/度）


A2 减低收费  
申请条件于合约上所订功率在6.9千伏安或以下及最近6个月内的每月耗电量在120度或以下的客户。  
价格:  
- 订定功率功率费:至6.9 千伏安 0.00（澳门元）  
- 电能费用: 0.858（澳门元/度）


A3 社福收费  
申请条件在社会福利领域开展非营利且公认为重要的活动的公共或私人实体；需提供由权限主管部门发出的有关从事非牟利及社会活动性质的证明文件。  
价格:  
- 订定功率功率费:至3.4 千伏安 8.224（澳门元）  
- 电能费用: 0.884（澳门元/度）

A4 社援收费  
申请条件凡被澳门社会工作局列入社会援助计划的住宅客户，其订定功率在6.9千伏安或以下及最近6个月内的每月耗电量在120度或以下；需提供由澳门社会工作局发出的有效社会援助卡。  
价格:  
- 订定功率功率费:至6.9千伏安 0.00（澳门元）  
- 电能费用: 0.429（澳门元/度）

备注: [1] 2022年6月27日之第25/2022号行政法规。  
[2] 2022年6月27日之第105/2022号行政长官批示。
",

    }
}

4.4 The Company holds the right to demand an update of the guarantee 
whenever there is an increase in subscribed demand or the 
reconstitution thereof when used, in whole or in part, to settle any 
debit payable by the Customer to the Company.
4.5 Failure to update the guarantee within a period of thirty days from 
the date of written communication served to the Customer to that 
effect is deemed sufficient reason for suspension of supply by the 
Company.
4.6 The amount and regulations of the guarantee, pursuant to paragraph 
4.1 hereof, are established by the Macau Special Administrative 
Region under the terms provided in Schedule 1.
5. Ordinary and extraordinary contracts  (5)
5.1 The Company may sign with the Customer ordinary and extraordinary 
contracts, pursuant to the general provisions of the present 
document.
5.2 Special contracts signed with large customers and temporary 
electricity supply contracts are considered extraordinary.
5.3 Any other contracts not covered by the previous paragraph are 
considered ordinary.
6. Special large Customers’ contracts  (6)
6.1 The Company may sign special contracts with large customers 
whereof the Macau Special Administrative Region may consider of 
special relevance to the economy.
6.2 Customers referred to under the previous paragraph may benefit from 
special tariffs, taking into account the characteristics of each customer 
and subject to prior approval from the Macau Special Administrative 
Region, under the Company’s proposal.",

“一般充电收费即私人充电，适用设置于非属公共充电收费的充电设施且设置「时段收费」。一般充电收费是按每月总充电量收费并根据下列项目计算：

功率费（以千伏安计算）按供电合约所订定的最大电力负荷 (订定功率值)计算。

充电量就每发单月使用电力充电的总电量。

电能费用（以千瓦时（度）计算）按充电量计算。

收费调整系数 收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。

政府税就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。

价格
功率费订定功率功率费不高于3.4 千伏安8.224 (澳门元)高于3.4千伏安但不高于 6.9 千伏安18.796 (澳门元)高于6.9千伏安3.372 (澳门元/千伏安)

电能费用
收费时段时间电能费用
繁忙时间(11个小时)09:00 - 20:00 1.552 (澳门元/千瓦时)
非繁忙时间(13个小时)20:00 - 09:00 0.817 (澳门元/千瓦时)

计算方法：
充电费用 = 功率费 + (充电量 x (电能费用 + 收费调整系数)) + 政府税

范例：
单位单位价额 （澳门元） 金额（澳门元）
功率费6.9千伏安 18.80
电费 (繁忙时间)40度1.552 62.08
电费 (非繁忙时间)160度0.817 130.72
收费调整系数200度0.400 80.00
政府税（0.75 x √6.9） 2.00
合共 293.60”",

Sale of Electricity
17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

- 政府税按公式0.75 x √13.8计算，金额为2.80澳门元。
- 合共金额为538.93澳门元。

    "page_content": "社援收费申请条件：凡被澳门社会工作局列入社会援助计划的住宅客户，其订定功率在6.9千伏安以下，且最近6个月内的每月耗电量在120度或以下。申请人需提供由澳门社会工作局发出的有效社会援助卡。若符合上述条件，本公司将在申请后自动按此项收费计算。

价格：
- 订定功率功率费用为：至6.9千伏安时，功率费用为0澳门元，电能费用为0.429澳门元/度。

电费单范例：
- 电费为100度，电能费用为0.429澳门元/度，总金额为42.90澳门元。
- 收费调整系数为100度，调整费用为0.340澳门元/度，总金额为34.00澳门元。
- 政府税按公式0.75 x √6.9计算，税额为2.00澳门元。
- 最终合计金额为78.90澳门元。

备注：根据2022年6月27日第25/2022号行政法规则和第105/2022号行政长官批示。

    "page_content": "88
Final Provisions
22. Private generation  (22)
22.1 A Customer with private electricity generation is allowed to use the 
energy generated by its own plant only in case of emergency and 
limited duration tests, except for specially authorized cases under the 
terms and conditions to be provided in the relevant supply contract.
22.2 The Customer, when signing the electricity supply contract or later, 
upon installation, is obliged to inform the Company, in written, of the 
existence at the premises of its own means of generation.
22.3 Except through written permission from the Company, attached as 
schedule to the relevant electricity supply contract including technical 
rules to be observed, a Customer who owns a private electricity 
generator is not allowed to operate its own plant in parallel with the 
public network.
23. Fraud (23)
23.1 Any fraudulent procedure susceptible to forge the reading of energy 
or the demand, namely the capture of electricity prior (“upstream”) 
to the meter, tampering of meters or demand control devices, as well 
as alterations to safety devices performed through the breaking of the 
seal or lock, is considered a noncompliance of the electricity supply 
contract.
23.2 Any fraudulent procedures detected within an installation that uses 
electricity located inside a residential unit or any other compound or 
location wherein the Customer has exclusive access or subjected to 
the control thereof, is considered, unless otherwise proven, imputable 
to the Customer.",

{
    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

3. Guarantee update (29)
3.1 When the requested alteration aims to increase the subscribed 
demand, the Company may constraint the efficacy of such contractual 
alteration to the reinforcement of the relevant guarantee, based on the 
general tariff class A1 in effect on the date such reinforcement is 
made.
3.2 When the requested alteration aims to decrease the subscribed 
demand, the Company shall inform the Customer, as the case may be, 
that he may:
a) Opt to receive the difference from the guarantee, in cash 
or in cheque, or clear the same against the payment of 
consumption and other charges to be included in subsequent 
bills;
b) Choose to replace the guarantee provided under paragraph 
1.2.
3.3 Provided there is no increase to subscribed demand, no update of 
guarantee shall be required from Customers who change tariff rate or 
if being signers of more than a contract for the same building, change 
the number of such contracts.
4. Lapse of the guarantee  (30)
4.1 The lapse of a contract implies the obligation of the Company to 
reimburse the Customer of the amount equal to the guarantee, with 
deduction of any amount eventually due.
4.2 When the guarantee is granted through any of the methods provided 
under paragraph 1.2 hereof and there is no amount due, the lapse of 
the contract shall bind the Company to issue a document whereby it 
renounces to the guarantee.",

{
    "page_content": "
了解我的账单

1. 合约号：当查询供电事宜或账单时，请提供此号码。
2. 应付总金额：应缴费用的总数。
3. 到期付款日：客户须于此日期或之前缴付电费。若逾期缴费，将在下月账单内征收逾期附加费。
4. 自动转账资料（只适用于自动转账客户）：此栏印有自动转账的银行名称及过数日期。
5. 下月抄表日期：安排于此日期抄读用电度数。
6. 用电时期：上月抄表日期至本月抄表日期及之间的用电天数。
7. 用电量（度）：将本月读数与上月读数相减，再乘以乘数值。
8. 按金：按订定功率值（电表大小）计算，用以保证客户依时缴付所有电费。
9. 收费调整系数：按季度调整以反映电力生产和购买之成本上的浮动。
10. 政府税：就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。",

}

{
    "page_content": "供电条件规范 - 摘要  
合约的范围澳电将按照所有规章及客户所定的功率供应电力。   
合约的条件  
2.1 供电合约的有效期为一个月，得以相同期限自动续期。  
2.2 如客户欲取消合约，应最少提前五个工作日书面通知澳电，并负责缴清所有关于用电量及功率的欠款。   

供应电力的可靠性及中断  
3.1 电力的供应是不间断和持续的，其中断或限制只能因工作理由、意外或不可抗力的原因、事先协议或可归责于客户的行为而发生。  
3.5 凡属计划性停电，澳电需要提前36小时逐一通知客户；若未能逐一通知时，将透过传播媒界通知客户。  

电费  
8.1 电费最迟应于抄表后十五天内在澳电办事处缴付或按账单背面所指的方式透过指定机构缴付。  
8.2 如截至载于账单上的缴费日期仍未缴费，则须就欠款金额缴付附加费，且可在自上述日期起计五个工作天后被暂停供电。  

按金  
9.1 签约时，澳电有权要求户缴交按金，其全部或部分可用于缴付客户欠缴的部分或全部费用。  
9.3 合约届满时，按金将在扣除客户欠缴的费用后发还。  

投诉及要求  
10.1 澳电欢迎客户透过资询通及/或其他渠道就我们的服务作出要求及/或投诉。  
10.2 客户进行有关账单的投诉时，所有调整中的欠缴费用将暂时无须缴付直至得出调查结果为止。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/about-cem/power-supply-technical-information/standard-condition-of-supply/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/about-cem/power-supply-technical-information/standard-condition-of-supply/"
    }
}

    "page_content": "申请供电所需文件：
业权人身份证明文件副本
最近三个月发出的查屋纸
如申请人为租户，另须提供：
租户身份证明文件副本

如申请单位为非住宅用途，另须提供：
电力装置位置图（适用于申请功率高于20.7千伏安）
《电力装置用途/电业工程人员声明书》及其身份证明文件副本
土地工务局发出以申请人及订定功率申请的电力装置使用许可证
补充内容：
如果申请单位涉及特别用途或有其他特殊要求，需额外提交相关文件（例如特殊行业许可证、相关行政审批文件等）。
应付费用：
需缴交附加之电缆接驳费（如需要）
工程费用（如需要）
按金（根据所申请的订定功率收取）
补充内容：
按金费用是根据申请的功率来决定的，且通常在后续结算时进行调整。
费用标准可能根据实际情况有所变化，请参考澳电最新的收费表。
订定功率及按金费标准：
3.4千伏安 (1x16安培) 澳门币 65.00
6.9千伏安 (1x32安培) 澳门币 132.00
11.5千伏安 (1x50安培) 澳门币 219.00
13.8千伏安 (3x20安培) 澳门币 399.00
20.7千伏安 (3x32安培) 澳门币 598.00
34.5千伏安 (3x50安培) 澳门币 854.00
补充内容：
以上费用标准适用于不同功率要求的客户，具体费用可能会根据地区、项目复杂度或特定需求有所变化。
需要注意的是，标准费用适用于常规安装，对于高功率或特殊安装需求可能需要额外费用。
所需时间：
四个工作天内完成

客户的电力工程：步骤和要求的相关信息 补充内容：
客户需要按照规定的步骤进行工程申请，包括设计方案的审批、施工准备、设备安装等环节。
所有电力工程必须符合澳电的安全标准，并通过必要的验收程序。
电力加大评估及功率计算器的使用说明 补充内容：
澳电提供功率计算器工具，帮助客户评估所需的电力容量，并根据实际需求选择合适的功率。

[1] 如申请人未能亲身办理申请， 可签署授权书以委托他人代办。
[2] 如申请涉及合并单位，另须提供土地工务局核准的更改工程 (修改) 计划。
[3] 澳门居民身份证、香港居民身份证、中华人民共和国居民身份证或各国护照。
[4] 如申请人为公司/社团，须提供最近三个月发出的公司商业/社团登记副本及其电能供应合约须由法定代表人签署。
[5] 如最近三个月发出的查屋纸仍未更改为新的业权人，客户可再递交经律师见证的买卖楼宇合约／银行三方约／屋契／物业转移税单（M1&M2）副本作参考，但需审批。
[6] 如以租户身份申请，则无需提供业权人的身份证明文件副本。
[7] 位置图须清晰显示客户电力装置及电表的所在位置。如有需要，需提供进一步的资料。
[8] 此声明书须由申请人或公司/ 社团的法定代表人签署。「电业工程人员声明书」部份只适用于具备电力装置使用准照的供电申请及更改订定功率申请。
[9] 指电力装置属第3 5 /2 0 1 1 号行政法规的适用范围内。
[10] 指澳电可自由进出电力装置处。
[11] 不涉及任何客户或澳电工程，并已缴付相应费用。",

entities.description: The 2022 electricity subsidy measures are initiatives launched by the Macau government to alleviate financial burdens on residents and businesses by providing monthly subsidies.
Electricity Costs are the expenses incurred for the energy consumed during the charging of electric vehicles, calculated per kilowatt-hour.
Metering equipment is used to measure energy consumption and demand, and is supplied and maintained by the Company.
申请条件outlines the requirements that customers must meet to qualify for different fee structures under A组收费.
Consumption Charges are fees incurred by the Customer based on their usage, which can be settled against the Guarantee.
充电流程describes the steps involved in using public charging services, from account setup to payment.

按金refers to the deposit that may be required as part of the application process.<SEP>按金是申请合约转名时需要支付的费用，通常根据所申请的订定功率收取。<SEP>按金refers to the deposit that澳电may require from customers at the time of signing the contract, which can be used to cover unpaid bills.<SEP>按金是根据客户的功率值计算的费用，用以保证客户按时缴付电费。<SEP>按金是根据申请的电力功率收取的费用，通常在后续结算时进行调整。

澳电offers various electricity fee assistance programs to help eligible customers manage their bills.
澳电offers Social Welfare Charges to non-profit organizations, supporting their operational costs related to electricity.
澳电provides Social Assistance Charges for customers with valid social assistance cards, helping them reduce their electricity costs.

政府税is a component of the overall电费that customers must pay monthly.<SEP>政府税is applied to the monthly electricity charges (电费) incurred by customers.<SEP>政府税is included in the total电费that is eligible for subsidy under the 2022 measures.
功率费is a component of the total电费that is subsidized under the 2022 measures.
客户are the recipients of the企业商号电费补贴, benefiting from the financial support provided.
The Guarantee is linked to the Electricity Supply, as it ensures the Customer's financial commitment to the service.
The Customer's Electricity Consumption is monitored and billed by the Company based on usage over time.
The Customer is responsible for their Energy Consumption, which is monitored and billed by the Company.
The Customer is responsible for the costs associated with the installation and maintenance of electrical systems and equipment.
Outstanding Bills must be paid by the Customer to avoid suspension of electricity supply by The Company.
The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.
CEM Macau issues the Electricity Bill to customers detailing their electricity usage and charges.
The Company supplies and maintains metering equipment necessary for billing electricity consumption.
The Company is responsible for managing energy metering processes to ensure accurate billing for customers.
The Company is responsible for the maintenance and repair of the Metering Systems that measure electricity usage.
The applicant must submit the电费单to show proof of payment for electricity as part of the application process.<SEP>申请人需提交电费单作为申请终止合约的必要文件。

query: 為什麼我會收到估算電費單？澳電如何估算？
response:
### 為什麼會收到估算電費單？

您可能會收到估算電費單的原因是因為在某個月份未能進行抄表。例如，如果因客戶的缺席或其他原因導致電表無法正常讀數，則公司會根據過去十二個月的平均使用量來估算您的電費。這樣的估算方式將在下次記錄實際電量時進行調整，結算實際消耗量。

**參考資料**：
- [KG] doc_162_pdf_education_Supply_Elec2009_zh_29d77038c5.pdf.json
- [KG] doc_158_pdf_education_Supply_Elec2009_zh_29d77038c5.pdf.json
- [DC] doc_158_pdf_education_Supply_Elec2009_zh_29d77038c5.pdf
- [DC] doc_157_pdf_education_Supply_Elec2009_zh_29d77038c5.pdf
- [DC] doc_29_1655149a3d623c1673f1356d85a71722.json
answer: 抄錶員每月均在賬單上的「下月抄錶日期」到訪抄讀電錶度數。若抄錶員在無法進行抄錶的情況下，澳電將按第43/91/M號法令第19條第3款的規定，以過去12個月的平均用電量估算該月用電量並發出估算電費單。

{
    "page_content": "80
14. Inspection of installations (14)
14.1 The Company reserves the right to inspect the installations connected 
to its network, namely the switching and transformer substations, 
the building’s collective installations, service-entrance lines and 
Customer’s installations, as well as apparatus thereof, at any time 
and through duly authorized agents. It may also inspect and take the 
measurements deemed necessary, however, in the case of residential 
premises, such inspections are restricted to 09:00 to 18:00 schedule, 
during workdays, or any other schedule duly convened between the 
Customer and the Company to carry out the inspection.
14.2 The inspections hereinbefore referred to do not imply any liability 
of the Company, and shall not exempt the Customer from his/her 
responsibility in the state of repair and operation of the installation.
14.3 The Customer is obliged to grant access of the referred agents to the 
installation; in case of refusal or if the installation or the receptors 
therein are deemed to endanger the safety of persons and property, the 
Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply, declining 
any compensation, whereof it shall inform immediately the inspection 
entity.
14.4 The Company reserves the right to suspend the supply of electricity 
without compensation, whenever the Customer fails to execute, 
within the appointed term, the works of repair or alterations deemed 
necessary after inspection pursuant to paragraph 14.1 hereof.
15. Interruptions and restrictions to supply  (15)
15.1 Electricity supply is permanent and continual whereof interruptions 
or restrictions are only those in result of limitations to consumption 
determined by the Macau Special Administrative Region, service, 
fortuitous events or force majeure, prior accord, acts imputable to the 
Customer or third parties or by interruption or restriction to imported 
electricity supply.",

{
    "page_content": "84
Sale of Electricity
17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

{
    "page_content": "89Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
23.3 When suspicion of fraudulent procedure arises, the Company shall 
request the presence of two witnesses, duly credentialed by competent 
authorities, to confirm or deny the existence of fraud.
23.4 When the existence of fraud is confirmed and imputable to the 
Customer, the Company reserves the right:
a) To be reimbursed for the amount corresponding to energy 
illicitly consumed and of any expenses related to the 
elimination of the fraud, namely the repair or replacement 
of damaged equipment;
b) To withhold supply until full payment is made of the amount 
due according to the previous subparagraph.
24. Value of energy illicitly consumed  (24)
24.1 The value of the energy illicitly consumed is computed by the 
Company, based on the highest tariff set for the subgroup contracted 
by the Customer, plus 25%, taking into account all the facts relevant 
to the computation of real consumption during the period wherein 
the fraudulent procedure took place, namely the characteristics of the 
installation, its schedule of operation, previous readings, if any, and 
posterior readings, if necessary.
24.2 When there are no elements to allow an objective computation of 
energy illicitly consumed, the relevant value is computed using the 
following rules:
a) Low-voltage Customers
Pc up to 20.7 kV A ................. 50-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 34.5kV A to 69 kV ..... 70-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 100 kV A to 340 kV A .100-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc above 340 kV A ........... 200-hour monthly usage of Pc
b) Medium-voltage Customers .... 300-hour monthly usage of Pc
Whereof “Pc” is the demand subscribed by the Customer
24.3 Estimation performed in the terms of the previous paragraph 
comprises the period in relation thereto proof was presented wherein 
such irregular consumption was maintained or, if such evidence does 
not exist, a period of thirty-six months.",

{
    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

{
    "page_content": "
了解我的账单

1. 合约号：当查询供电事宜或账单时，请提供此号码。
2. 应付总金额：应缴费用的总数。
3. 到期付款日：客户须于此日期或之前缴付电费。若逾期缴费，将在下月账单内征收逾期附加费。
4. 自动转账资料（只适用于自动转账客户）：此栏印有自动转账的银行名称及过数日期。
5. 下月抄表日期：安排于此日期抄读用电度数。
6. 用电时期：上月抄表日期至本月抄表日期及之间的用电天数。
7. 用电量（度）：将本月读数与上月读数相减，再乘以乘数值。
8. 按金：按订定功率值（电表大小）计算，用以保证客户依时缴付所有电费。
9. 收费调整系数：按季度调整以反映电力生产和购买之成本上的浮动。
10. 政府税：就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/understand-my-bill/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/understand-my-bill/"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

        "producer": "Acrobat Distiller 8.1.0 (Macintosh)",

repair and restoration involving the installation operated by the 
same, as well as service-entrance line, collective line distributing

from negligence or lack of care on the part of the Customer, in which 
case the costs shall be borne by the latter.
13.4 By express agreement between the parties, included in the supply 
contract, the Customer may undertake the responsibility to maintain, 
repair and restore the switching and transformer substation that serve

13.5 The Company reserves the right to claim compensation for material 
damage caused to the meter or any other equipment owned by the 
same and placed in the Customer’s premises, provided the liability of 
the latter may be proven.
13.6 The liability of the Customer does not cover loss or deterioration by 
accidental fire or any unpredicted event or force majeure pursuant 
to paragraph 15.2 hereof, neither any damage resulting from normal 
wear and tear to the equipment in question.
13.7 The Customer is obliged to notify the Company, at once, of any defect 
detected with the devices or their functioning, otherwise subject to 
liability for any damage in result of such defect. Such notice shall be 
served through any means deemed convenient to the Customer and, 
if possible, with written confirmation.",

{
    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

{
    "page_content": "A组收费
适用于以低压电网(230/400伏特)供电的客户：
•   其订定功率在69千伏安以下，或
•   其订定功率高于69千伏安，但未被包括在B组及C组收费内。

收费类别
A1 - 一般收费
A2 - 平民收费
A3 - 社会慈善机构收费
A4 - 社会援助收费

收费
A组收费根据下列项目计算：
订定功率2 (以千伏安计算)
•   供电合约所订定的最大电力负荷，由电表规格及其保护设备所控制。
电费 (以千瓦时(度)计算)
•   于用电期间的总耗电量。
收费调整系数
•   收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。
政府税
•   就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。
备注
(1) 86年8月30日之第35/86/M号法令。
(2) 2005年7月18日之第11/2005号行政法规。
(3) 2004年8月9日之第23/2004号行政命令。  
(4) 2007年3月19日之第5/2007号行政法规。
(5) 税项的计算方式按客户电力装置种类而定（住宅、商业或工业）。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/uploads/pdf_education_Tariff_A_zh_881af653dd.pdf",
        "topic": "A组收费方法以及记算"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "A组收费
A3  社会慈善机构收费
申请条件：
•   从事于社会活动的非牟利公营或私营机构；
•   需附有由澳门社会工作局发出的有关从事非牟利及社会活动性质的文件。

收费调整系数  422      0.26     109.72
政府税(0.75x √13.8)              2.80
合共                            532.1",

{
    "page_content": "社援收费申请条件：凡被澳门社会工作局列入社会援助计划的住宅客户，其订定功率在6.9千伏安以下，且最近6个月内的每月耗电量在120度或以下。申请人需提供由澳门社会工作局发出的有效社会援助卡。若符合上述条件，本公司将在申请后自动按此项收费计算。

价格：
- 订定功率功率费用为：至6.9千伏安时，功率费用为0澳门元，电能费用为0.429澳门元/度。

电费单范例：
- 电费为100度，电能费用为0.429澳门元/度，总金额为42.90澳门元。
- 收费调整系数为100度，调整费用为0.340澳门元/度，总金额为34.00澳门元。
- 政府税按公式0.75 x √6.9计算，税额为2.00澳门元。
- 最终合计金额为78.90澳门元。

备注：根据2022年6月27日第25/2022号行政法规则和第105/2022号行政长官批示。
",

        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billpaymentpromotion/social-tariff/"
    }
}

1.5 The Customer is obliged to inform the Company of any unauthorized 
electric lines that by any means may come to his knowledge, whether 
emanating from his/her installation, the pothead or the transformer 
substation that supplies the contracted electricity.
2. Supply contract  (2)
2.1 In addition to the acceptance by both parties of conditions provided 
under the standard contract, the electricity supply contract shall 
include the following elements:
a) Particulars of both parties and their capacity;
b) Location of electricity supply;
c) Purpose of installation;
d) Supply voltage;
e) Subscribed demand;
f) Contract type;
g) Tariff group;
h) Signing date.
2.2 The supply contract may include other conditions provided that such 
shall not contravene existing legislation.
2.3 In the terms and to the effect of sub-paragraph 2.1 a) hereof, the 
Customer is obliged to submit evidence of the capacity invoked for 
the signing of the contract.
2.4 If irregularities are found with any of the documents submitted or if 
there is already a contract for the same location whose subscriber, 
of his/her own right, does not wish to terminate, the contract hereof 
shall be considered null and void.",

{
    "page_content": "73Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
6.3 The validity of special large Customers’ contracts, as well as the 
status of their operation, tariffs and applicable tariff periods as well 
as any other particular provisions shall be established on a case-by-
case basis and shall be covered by the relevant supply contract.
7. Temporary contracts  (7)
7.1 The Company may sign temporary electricity supply contracts for 
non-permanent installations, for a pre-determined limited term, 
provided technical conditions are favorable to that effect and that 
inconvenience to the distribution network may not result therefrom.
7.2 Temporary electricity supply contracts imply the installation of 
provisional branch lines.
8. Contractual term  (8)
8.1 Ordinary electricity supply contracts are signed for an initial term of 
one month, automatically and successively renewable for the same 
period, notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph 8.3 hereof.
8.2 Temporary contracts have a limited term, wherefore the beginning 
and the end of their validity is explicitly set in the supply contract.
8.3 The Customer, in written and with a minimum notice of five working 
days, must inform the Company of his/her intention to terminate any 
contract signed under the terms provided in paragraphs 8.1 and 8.2 
hereof, wherefore the Customer shall be liable for any amount due 
until the removal of the meters, which shall be carried out during the 
same period.
8.4 The term for special large customer contracts is specified in the 
respective supply contract pursuant to clause 6 hereof.",

entities.description: Billing Procedures outline the methods and timelines for charging Customers for their electricity consumption based on meter readings.

Monthly Usage refers to the estimated consumption of electricity by Customers, which is used to calculate charges in cases of fraud.

query: 什麼原因令抄錶員無法抄讀電錶？
response:
### 抄表员无法抄读电表的原因

抄表员无法抄读电表的原因可能包括客户未允许进入抄读、抄表期间客户缺席、或者电表故障等情况。如果抄表无法进行，可能会导致开具的账单基于过去的平均用电量，影响客户的电费正确性。长时间未能抄读还可能导致断电的风险。

####
answer: 無法進入私人地方：在大廈鐵閘或電錶房門被鎖而又未能聯絡負責人開門，或店舖已關門等情況下，抄錶員均無法抄讀電錶。斷路器被關掉：有些客戶因單位空置而關掉電錶旁的斷路器，電錶上的電子顯示屏因而無法顯示讀數。基於用電安全理由，抄錶員不會在未能掌握戶內用電的情況下重啟斷路器。如客戶需暫時中斷戶內的供電，只需關掉戶內的斷路器即可。危險環境：基於人身安全理由，當抄錶員判定現場環境有潛在危險，如電錶高度達2米或被雜物阻擋等，便不會進入該範圍內抄錶。客戶須保持電錶周圍環境安全和清潔，以便抄錶員可成功抄錶。 惡劣天氣：受颱風或水浸等惡劣天氣影響，抄錶員無法安全到達抄錶目的地。

17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

15.9 Notices of supply interruption shall contain a warning of live 
installations.
16. Suspension of supply  (16)
16.1 The Company may suspend the supply of electricity when any of the 
following events imputable to the Customer occur:
a) Noncompliance with provisions that aim to eliminate 
any type of disruption to network operation and other 
installations, as well as in concern to the safety of persons 
and property;
b) Impossibility to read meters as covered by clause 17 
hereof;
c) Opposition to inspection of installations within the 
appointed schedule;
d) Failure to pay bills for energy consumption and demand, as 
well as any additional charges and services, within the term 
provided;
e) Fraud, as provided under paragraph 23.4;
f) Failure to update the guarantee within the term provided 
after being served notice to that effect by the Company;
g) In the situation provided under paragraph 9.4;
h) Failure to regularize default situations provided under 
paragraph 1.4 or clause 22, hereof, within the term provided 
to that effect by the Company.
16.2 Interruption of supply in situation provided under the previous 
paragraph shall not exempt the Customer from possible civil or 
criminal liability.
16.3 In the case provided under subparagraph 16.1 d), the Company 
reserves the right to withhold reconnection from the Customer until 
all outstanding bills are paid and, if necessary, the guarantee referred 
to under clause 4, hereof duly replenished, wherefore reconnection is 
subject to the payment of a charge in the terms of the Law.",

    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",
