{
    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

The Customer's Electricity Consumption is monitored and billed by the Company based on usage over time.

The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.
The Company bills customers based on their electricity consumption, which is measured monthly.
The Company operates within the Electricity Billing System to manage billing and collection of electricity consumption from customers.
The Company implements the Billing and Collection Process to manage how bills are issued and payments are collected.

augmented_query: What are the key features of electronic invoices? How do electronic bills differ from traditional paper bills?

query: 如何避免忘記支付我的賬單?
response:
### 如何避免忘记支付我的账单？

为了避免忘记支付账单，您可以选择自动转账或电子支付等便捷的支付方式。使用自动转账，电费会直接从您的银行账户扣除，确保按时付款。电子支付也提供灵活性，您可以随时通过网上银行或移动应用完成支付。此外，设置手机推送通知或短信提醒，让您及时收到付款到期的提醒。

####
answer: 申請自動轉賬服務即可輕鬆使用您的銀行賬戶或信用卡繳付賬單。如果您想更方便一些，可申請繳費提示服務並於賬單發單日、到期付款日與避免截電日前以短信或電郵接收有關提示，而當自動轉賬交易失效時，您亦會收到有關通知。

{
    "page_content": "82
15.9 Notices of supply interruption shall contain a warning of live 
installations.
16. Suspension of supply  (16)
16.1 The Company may suspend the supply of electricity when any of the 
following events imputable to the Customer occur:
a) Noncompliance with provisions that aim to eliminate 
any type of disruption to network operation and other 
installations, as well as in concern to the safety of persons 
and property;
b) Impossibility to read meters as covered by clause 17 
hereof;
c) Opposition to inspection of installations within the 
appointed schedule;
d) Failure to pay bills for energy consumption and demand, as 
well as any additional charges and services, within the term 
provided;
e) Fraud, as provided under paragraph 23.4;
f) Failure to update the guarantee within the term provided 
after being served notice to that effect by the Company;
g) In the situation provided under paragraph 9.4;
h) Failure to regularize default situations provided under 
paragraph 1.4 or clause 22, hereof, within the term provided 
to that effect by the Company.
16.2 Interruption of supply in situation provided under the previous 
paragraph shall not exempt the Customer from possible civil or 
criminal liability.
16.3 In the case provided under subparagraph 16.1 d), the Company 
reserves the right to withhold reconnection from the Customer until 
all outstanding bills are paid and, if necessary, the guarantee referred 
to under clause 4, hereof duly replenished, wherefore reconnection is 
subject to the payment of a charge in the terms of the Law.",

    "page_content": "84
Sale of Electricity
17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

{
    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

{
    "page_content": "
了解我的账单

1. 合约号：当查询供电事宜或账单时，请提供此号码。
2. 应付总金额：应缴费用的总数。
3. 到期付款日：客户须于此日期或之前缴付电费。若逾期缴费，将在下月账单内征收逾期附加费。
4. 自动转账资料（只适用于自动转账客户）：此栏印有自动转账的银行名称及过数日期。
5. 下月抄表日期：安排于此日期抄读用电度数。
6. 用电时期：上月抄表日期至本月抄表日期及之间的用电天数。
7. 用电量（度）：将本月读数与上月读数相减，再乘以乘数值。
8. 按金：按订定功率值（电表大小）计算，用以保证客户依时缴付所有电费。
9. 收费调整系数：按季度调整以反映电力生产和购买之成本上的浮动。
10. 政府税：就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。",

{
    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

entities.description: Online Services allow customers to manage their electricity accounts, track application progress, and make inquiries.
电子支付encompasses various electronic methods for paying bills, including online banking and mobile payments.
Billing Procedures outline the methods and timelines for charging Customers for their electricity consumption based on meter readings.
自动转账资料是指自动转账客户的银行名称及过数日期，便于客户管理电费支付。
Payment Due Date is the deadline by which customers must pay their electricity bill to avoid late fees.
The Billing and Collection Process outlines the procedures for issuing bills and collecting payments for electricity services.
Electricity Bill refers to the statement detailing the amount owed for electricity usage, including various charges and due dates.
账单是电力公司向客户发送的费用清单，详细列出用户的用电量和应支付的电费。
Outstanding Bills refer to unpaid charges for energy consumption and services that the Customer owes to The Company.
Billing Corrections involve adjustments made to customer bills when errors or anomalies in metering are identified, ensuring fair charges.
无感支付refers to a payment method that allows for automatic payment once pre-registered.
手机推送通知是通过澳电微信或澳电APP接收电子账单的方式。
自动转账is a payment method that allows automatic deduction of electricity bills from a bank account.
手机短讯是接收电子账单的一种方式，申请后即时生效。
极易付is a payment service in Macau that provides convenient options for paying bills.
Cash Payment is a method of providing a guarantee by the Customer for electricity supply contracts, ensuring immediate availability of funds.

relationships.description: Outstanding Bills must be paid by the Customer to avoid suspension of electricity supply by The Company.
Billing errors directly affect the Customer's financial obligations and require resolution by the Company.
The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.
The Company implements the Billing and Collection Process to manage how bills are issued and payments are collected.
自助服务机provides an electronic option for customers to pay their electricity bills as part of电费缴交.
自动转账is one of the methods included in电费缴交for paying electricity bills.
电子支付is another method available under电费缴交for customers to pay their bills electronically.
一户通facilitates various utility payments, including electricity bills, under电费缴交.
广发澳门provides free bill payment services for electricity, enhancing电费缴交options.
The Payment Due Date is specified on the Electricity Bill, indicating when payment must be made.
Online Services are part of澳电's offerings, allowing customers to manage their accounts and track applications online.
Debits Due represent the amounts the Customer must pay to the Company following corrections to their billing.
CEM Macau issues the Electricity Bill to customers detailing their electricity usage and charges.
政府税是Electricity Bill中包含的费用，客户需按月支付。
收费调整系数在Electricity Bill中反映电力成本的变化。
按金是Electricity Bill中提到的费用，确保客户按时支付电费。
The Customer benefits from Billing Corrections, which ensure they are charged accurately for their energy consumption.
The Customer must provide Notification to the Company when they identify errors in their billing or metering.
到期付款日是Electricity Bill中指明的客户需在此日期前支付的最后期限。
极易付offers convenient options for paying electricity bills included in电费缴交.
支票is a method of payment that falls under the category of电费缴交for settling electricity bills.
自动转账资料帮助客户管理Electricity Bill的支付方式。
Cash Payment is one of the methods by which the Customer can fulfill the Guarantee requirement for electricity supply contracts.

augmented_query: How can I set up automatic bill payments to avoid forgetting? What reminders can I use to help me remember to pay my bills on time?

query: 賬單發單時期為多久？
response:
### 账单发单周期

电力公司将在抄表后最多三个工作日内向客户发放账单，账单会详细列出用电量及应支付的金额。账单的到期付款日则是规定客户须在此日期前完成付款以避免滞纳金。

####
answer:
### 账单发单时期

电力公司通常会在每月固定的时间进行抄表，并根据抄表结果生成账单。账单会在读表后的三个工作日内送达客户，确保客户能及时收到用电信息。

**

{
    "page_content": "84
Sale of Electricity
17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

{
    "page_content": "71Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
3. Signing terms  (3)
3.1 The supply contract shall only be signed between the Company and 
any person who is capable of showing, with probity, to hold due rights 
or possession, in its own name or other persons, over the property, or 
any fraction thereof, whereto electricity must be supplied.
3.2 Due rights or possession is deemed as ownership rights, tenancy 
rights, floor leasing and the gratuitous or onerous transfer of the 
property, to be supplied with electricity or any part thereof.
3.3 In the case of gratuitous transfer the holder of such right is obliged 
to show evidence of the legitimacy of such possession by means of a 
declaration signed by the grantor of the gratuitous transfer and duly 
certified in the terms of the Law.
3.4 The Customer shall only be able to sign a new supply contract after 
full settlement of any overdue debts with the Company.
4. Guarantee (Deposit)  (4)
4.1 The Company reserves the right to demand from the Customer, 
simultaneous with the signing of the contract, as a precondition to 
start the supply of electricity, a guarantee, the amount and specific 
regulations of which shall be set by the Macau Special Administrative 
Region.
4.2 The guarantee hereinbefore mentioned is to be used as security for 
the payment of any debt of the Customer with the Company, but does 
not imply any limit to the liability of the former before the latter.
4.3 A guarantee which has been deposited in cash shall be refunded in the 
term of the supply contract or any extensions thereto, after deduction 
of any debit due by the Customer to the Company, and shall revert in 
favor of the latter if not claimed within three years from the date of 
termination of the contract or the last extension thereof.",

{
    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

{
    "page_content": "1. 适用范围：C组适用于使用中压电网，且订定功率 ≥ 1,000 kVA（或857 kW）的客户。

2. 使用条件：欲改为C组，须至少有一个高用电季节（6‑9月）月份以C组收费。

3. 收费分类：C1为一般收费，C2为低压计算用电客户。

4. 功率计算公式：
  • 功率费依 P = 0.2 × Pc + 0.8 × Pu 计算，其中：
    – Pc：订定功率（kW），若Pu > Pc则Pc更新为Pu，若Pu在12个月内低于Pc则Pc下降为Pu。
    – Pu：该月最大记录功率（kW）。
  • C2需额外缴付最大功率1%作变压器铜损补偿。

5. 有功电能（千瓦时）：
  • 按实际用电量收费。
  • C2另需支付有功电能1%附加费补偿变压器铜损。

6. 无功电能（千乏时）：
  • 满负荷与繁忙时段：若无功电量 > 同时段有功电能60%，超出部分需付费。
  • 非繁忙时段：送往电网之无功电全数计费。
  • C2再加收同时段有功电能10%作无功补偿，该附加费：
    – 满负荷／繁忙时间收取；
    – 非繁忙时间减收。

7. 季节定义：
  • 高用电季节为6月至9月；
  • 低用电季节为10月至翌年5月。

8. 计费时段分类：
  • 满负荷：10:30‑13:00、14:30‑16:00；
  • 繁忙：09:30‑10:30、13:00‑14:30、16:00‑20:30；
  • 非繁忙：00:00‑09:30、20:30‑24:00。

9. 价格一览（澳门元）：
  • 功率费：C1 = 19.797 元/kW；C2 = 21.484 元/kW
  • 有功电能（高季）：满负荷 1.432；繁忙 0.885；非繁忙 0.749
  • 有功电能（低季）：满负荷 0.776；繁忙 0.776；非繁忙 0.724
  • 无功电能（高季）：满负荷 0.348；繁忙 0.348；非繁忙 0.116
  • 无功电能（低季）：满负荷 0.348；繁忙 0.348；非繁忙 0.116

10. 其他附加条款：
   • 收费按照季度进行调整；
   • 额外另加政府税项。",
    "metadata": {

    }
}

    "page_content": "89Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
23.3 When suspicion of fraudulent procedure arises, the Company shall 
request the presence of two witnesses, duly credentialed by competent 
authorities, to confirm or deny the existence of fraud.
23.4 When the existence of fraud is confirmed and imputable to the 
Customer, the Company reserves the right:
a) To be reimbursed for the amount corresponding to energy 
illicitly consumed and of any expenses related to the 
elimination of the fraud, namely the repair or replacement 
of damaged equipment;
b) To withhold supply until full payment is made of the amount 
due according to the previous subparagraph.
24. Value of energy illicitly consumed  (24)
24.1 The value of the energy illicitly consumed is computed by the 
Company, based on the highest tariff set for the subgroup contracted 
by the Customer, plus 25%, taking into account all the facts relevant 
to the computation of real consumption during the period wherein 
the fraudulent procedure took place, namely the characteristics of the 
installation, its schedule of operation, previous readings, if any, and 
posterior readings, if necessary.
24.2 When there are no elements to allow an objective computation of 
energy illicitly consumed, the relevant value is computed using the 
following rules:
a) Low-voltage Customers

Pc from 100 kV A to 340 kV A .100-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc above 340 kV A ........... 200-hour monthly usage of Pc
b) Medium-voltage Customers .... 300-hour monthly usage of Pc
Whereof “Pc” is the demand subscribed by the Customer

comprises the period in relation thereto proof was presented wherein 
such irregular consumption was maintained or, if such evidence does 
not exist, a period of thirty-six months.",

15.9 Notices of supply interruption shall contain a warning of live 
installations.
16. Suspension of supply  (16)
16.1 The Company may suspend the supply of electricity when any of the 
following events imputable to the Customer occur:
a) Noncompliance with provisions that aim to eliminate 
any type of disruption to network operation and other 
installations, as well as in concern to the safety of persons 
and property;
b) Impossibility to read meters as covered by clause 17 
hereof;
c) Opposition to inspection of installations within the 
appointed schedule;
d) Failure to pay bills for energy consumption and demand, as 
well as any additional charges and services, within the term 
provided;
e) Fraud, as provided under paragraph 23.4;
f) Failure to update the guarantee within the term provided 
after being served notice to that effect by the Company;
g) In the situation provided under paragraph 9.4;
h) Failure to regularize default situations provided under 
paragraph 1.4 or clause 22, hereof, within the term provided 
to that effect by the Company.
16.2 Interruption of supply in situation provided under the previous 
paragraph shall not exempt the Customer from possible civil or 
criminal liability.
16.3 In the case provided under subparagraph 16.1 d), the Company 
reserves the right to withhold reconnection from the Customer until 
all outstanding bills are paid and, if necessary, the guarantee referred 
to under clause 4, hereof duly replenished, wherefore reconnection is 
subject to the payment of a charge in the terms of the Law.",

{
    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

{
    "page_content": "以下内容对用户有实际参考价值：

1. D组收费适用于以高压电网供电的客户。
2. 收费D组收费根据下列项目计算：
   - 功率 － 单位为千瓦，计算方式为：0.2Pc + 0.8Pu
   - Pu在所指发单月份内所记录的最大功率数值，单位为千瓦。
   - Pc订定功率单位为千瓦，订定功率不能低于由用户提供的变压站内变压器的总安装容量的百分之五十。
3. 收费调整系数收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产和购买成本上的浮动。
4. 收费时段
   - 繁忙时间：08:00 – 23:00
   - 非繁忙时间：23:00 - 08:00
5. D组收费价格：
   - 功率费 21.980（澳门元/千瓦）
   - 有功电能
     - 繁忙时间 0.770（澳门元/千瓦时）
     - 非繁忙时间 0.530（澳门元/千瓦时）
   - 无功电能
     - 繁忙时间 0.350（澳门元/千乏时）
     - 非繁忙时间 0.120（澳门元/千乏时） 

备注：相关法规为2022年6月27日之第25/2022号行政法规及第105/2022号行政长官批示。",

entities.description: Billing Procedures outline the methods and timelines for charging Customers for their electricity consumption based on meter readings.
Payment Due Date is the deadline by which customers must pay their electricity bill to avoid late fees.
Overdue Debts refer to any outstanding payments that the Customer must settle with the Company before signing a new supply contract.
Debits Due refer to amounts that the Customer owes to the Company as a result of corrections made to previous billing errors.

收费时段refers to the different billing periods categorized as full load, busy, and non-busy times.<SEP>收费时段refers to the different time periods during which electricity usage is charged at varying rates.<SEP>收费时段refers to the time periods during which different electricity rates apply, including busy and non-busy times.
下月抄表日期是安排抄读用电度数的日期，通常在账单中列出。
The Billing and Collection Process outlines the procedures for issuing bills and collecting payments for electricity services.
The Electricity Billing System refers to the procedures and regulations governing the billing and collection of electricity consumption.
Billing Errors are mistakes in the invoicing process that can lead to incorrect charges for energy consumption.
账单是电力公司向客户发送的费用清单，详细列出用户的用电量和应支付的电费。
Electricity Bill refers to the statement detailing the amount owed for electricity usage, including various charges and due dates.

relationships.description: 澳电provides electricity to customers based on the terms outlined in the电力供应合约.
Outstanding Bills must be paid by the Customer to avoid suspension of electricity supply by The Company.
The Customer has specific Obligations to fulfill under the electricity supply agreement, including payment and compliance with safety standards.
The Customer must provide notice within a specified number of Working Days to terminate any contract with the Company.
Debits Due represent the amounts the Customer must pay to the Company following corrections to their billing.
A Surcharge is applied to the Customer's bill if payment is not made by the due date.
The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.
CEM Macau issues the Electricity Bill to customers detailing their electricity usage and charges.
政府税是Electricity Bill中包含的费用，客户需按月支付。
The Company implements the Billing and Collection Process to manage how bills are issued and payments are collected.
The Customer is billed according to the Tariff set by the Company based on their energy consumption subgroup.
Billing errors directly affect the Customer's financial obligations and require resolution by the Company.
The Company operates within the Electricity Billing System to manage billing and collection of electricity consumption from customers.
D组收费在繁忙时间和非繁忙时间的收费标准有所不同。
The Payment Due Date is specified on the Electricity Bill, indicating when payment must be made.
收费时段categorizes the billing periods that affect how charges are applied to C组customers.
The Usage Period is reflected in the Electricity Bill, showing the duration of electricity consumption.
The Customer benefits from Billing Corrections, which ensure they are charged accurately for their energy consumption.
The Company implements Billing Corrections to address any discrepancies found in customer bills due to metering errors.
收费调整系数在Electricity Bill中反映电力成本的变化。

augmented_query: What is the billing cycle duration for invoices? How often are invoices issued in a specific period?

query: 什麼因素會影響單位耗電量和電費額？
response:
### 影响单元耗电量与电费的因素

单元耗电量和电费受多种因素影响，包括用电设备的功率和耗电时段。在高用电季节，电力费用通常会上升，尤其是在满负荷和繁忙时间段。此外，客户的订定功率、采取的收费结构和政府税等也会影响整体电费。对于具体的收费类别和费用详情，可以参考费用文档以获取更多信息。

**
answer: 電器的電力消耗會隨著氣候的改變而有所增加或減少。以夏天為例, 冷氣開放及雪櫃使用率增加，都會令耗電量上升；相應地在冬天，暖氣使用量亦為耗電量上升的原因之一。另外，經常性啟動某一電器、無故開啟一些低效率或經已損壞的電器時，都會令耗電量增加，電費額亦隨之上升。

Final Provisions
22. Private generation  (22)
22.1 A Customer with private electricity generation is allowed to use the 
energy generated by its own plant only in case of emergency and 
limited duration tests, except for specially authorized cases under the 
terms and conditions to be provided in the relevant supply contract.
22.2 The Customer, when signing the electricity supply contract or later, 
upon installation, is obliged to inform the Company, in written, of the 
existence at the premises of its own means of generation.
22.3 Except through written permission from the Company, attached as 
schedule to the relevant electricity supply contract including technical 
rules to be observed, a Customer who owns a private electricity 
generator is not allowed to operate its own plant in parallel with the 
public network.
23. Fraud (23)
23.1 Any fraudulent procedure susceptible to forge the reading of energy 
or the demand, namely the capture of electricity prior (“upstream”) 
to the meter, tampering of meters or demand control devices, as well 
as alterations to safety devices performed through the breaking of the 
seal or lock, is considered a noncompliance of the electricity supply 
contract.
23.2 Any fraudulent procedures detected within an installation that uses 
electricity located inside a residential unit or any other compound or 
location wherein the Customer has exclusive access or subjected to 
the control thereof, is considered, unless otherwise proven, imputable 
to the Customer.",

cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

{
    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

{
    "page_content": "社援收费申请条件：凡被澳门社会工作局列入社会援助计划的住宅客户，其订定功率在6.9千伏安以下，且最近6个月内的每月耗电量在120度或以下。申请人需提供由澳门社会工作局发出的有效社会援助卡。若符合上述条件，本公司将在申请后自动按此项收费计算。

价格：
- 订定功率功率费用为：至6.9千伏安时，功率费用为0澳门元，电能费用为0.429澳门元/度。

电费单范例：
- 电费为100度，电能费用为0.429澳门元/度，总金额为42.90澳门元。
- 收费调整系数为100度，调整费用为0.340澳门元/度，总金额为34.00澳门元。
- 政府税按公式0.75 x √6.9计算，税额为2.00澳门元。
- 最终合计金额为78.90澳门元。

备注：根据2022年6月27日第25/2022号行政法规则和第105/2022号行政长官批示。

{
    "page_content": "台风期间的支援服务  
于台风期间，市民可选择申请「停电讯息提示服务」以收取最新的停电推送讯息，以及联络澳电跟进事故。  
申请／更改停电讯息提示服务查询停电状态联络澳电跟进  
您可能还想知道如何申请「停电讯息提示服务」？  
1. 以微信扫瞄此二维码进入页面。  
2. 输入手机号码，并按「获取验证码」。输入验证码后，按「下一步」。  
3. 输入合约号码或大厦地址，按「新增」。  
4. 新增地址后，勾选同意相关条款，然后按「提交」。  
5. 成功登记！  
6. 如客户已登记「停电讯息提示服务」，于手机短讯验证后，即进入管理大厦地址页面。  

台风来临前的准备  
市民于台风期间应密切留意澳门气象局发布有关风暴潮警告及关注澳电Facebook和微信发布的消息，并可采取以下措施为台风的来临作好准备。  
人身安全请勿将车辆停泊在可能受水浸影响的地区及地下停车场；  
大厦供电系统可能会受水浸影响而断电，请勿乘坐升降机；  
请勿前往受水浸影响地区及地势较低的地区，因海水可在短时间内快速涌入陆地，导致水位急剧上升；  
逗留在安全和地势较高的地方，并远离地库或地下停车场等地势较低的地区；  
市民在台风期间尽可能留在家中，不要去观风、观浪，以免发生危险。  

大厦及商户尽量将电器、货物「升高」，以减低受水浸破坏；  
若身处地区经常出现海水倒灌，可用英泥封闭部分去水位，加设挡水板；  
物业管理公司可将电梯停在1楼位置，而不是地下层，以免水浸导致电梯损坏；  
如无必要长开电器如雪柜、冷气机等，最好关上配电箱总制；  
若身处低洼地区应作好事前准备，风暴来袭时避免留在店舖内；  
电力设备若受水浸影响，在使用前应聘请专业人士检查清楚设备是否可正常运作。  

电力安全及家居防护  
电力安全准备环保充电式或手摇式电筒；  
不要把电器放近窗边，以免被风雨沾湿受损；  
不要触碰受水浸湿的电力设施；  
若家中有维持生命的电动仪器，应安排后备电源或其他应变措施；  
如室内出现水浸情况，应立即关上配电箱总掣。  
家居防护于窗户上以“米”字型贴好胶纸，以防玻璃碎裂；  
检查门窗是否稳固，如有损坏应立即维修；  
远离门窗，以防松脱或碎裂时被击伤；  
移走阳台上容易被大风吹倒或堕下的物品，如花盆、晾衫竹；  
采取预防措施，如将物品放置在免受水浸影响的地方。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/our-community/optimizing-power-facilities-in-low-lying-areas/supporting-services-during-typhoon/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/our-community/optimizing-power-facilities-in-low-lying-areas/supporting-services-during-typhoon/"
    }
}

17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

{
    "page_content": "A组收费
适用于以低压电网(230/400伏特)供电的客户：
•   其订定功率在69千伏安以下，或
•   其订定功率高于69千伏安，但未被包括在B组及C组收费内。

收费类别
A1 - 一般收费
A2 - 平民收费
A3 - 社会慈善机构收费
A4 - 社会援助收费

收费
A组收费根据下列项目计算：
订定功率2 (以千伏安计算)
•   供电合约所订定的最大电力负荷，由电表规格及其保护设备所控制。
电费 (以千瓦时(度)计算)
•   于用电期间的总耗电量。
收费调整系数
•   收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。
政府税
•   就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。
备注
(1) 86年8月30日之第35/86/M号法令。
(2) 2005年7月18日之第11/2005号行政法规。
(3) 2004年8月9日之第23/2004号行政命令。  
(4) 2007年3月19日之第5/2007号行政法规。
(5) 税项的计算方式按客户电力装置种类而定（住宅、商业或工业）。",

{
    "page_content": "
了解我的账单

1. 合约号：当查询供电事宜或账单时，请提供此号码。
2. 应付总金额：应缴费用的总数。
3. 到期付款日：客户须于此日期或之前缴付电费。若逾期缴费，将在下月账单内征收逾期附加费。
4. 自动转账资料（只适用于自动转账客户）：此栏印有自动转账的银行名称及过数日期。
5. 下月抄表日期：安排于此日期抄读用电度数。
6. 用电时期：上月抄表日期至本月抄表日期及之间的用电天数。
7. 用电量（度）：将本月读数与上月读数相减，再乘以乘数值。
8. 按金：按订定功率值（电表大小）计算，用以保证客户依时缴付所有电费。
9. 收费调整系数：按季度调整以反映电力生产和购买之成本上的浮动。
10. 政府税：就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/understand-my-bill/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/understand-my-bill/"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "**公共充电收费 — 运输工具充电收费**

- **适用范围**：
  适用于中压或低压供电，专门针对用于电动运输工具的充电设施。
  公共充电指由澳电配置在公共停车场、公共泊车处或非设于公共道路泊车处的充电设施。

- **收费结构**：
  充电费用 = 功率费 + (充电量 × (电能费用 + 收费调整系数))

- **收费示例（以48度电为例）**：
  - 慢速充电（繁忙时间，约7小时）：48 × (2.150 + 0.400) = 122.40 澳门元
  - 慢速充电（非繁忙时间，约7小时）：48 × (1.420 + 0.400) = 87.36 澳门元
  - 中速充电（全天24小时，约2.5小时）：48 × (2.980 + 0.400) = 162.24 澳门元
  - 快速充电（全天24小时，约1.5小时）：48 × (3.440 + 0.400) = 184.32 澳门元

- **收费调整系数**：
  2024年第2季度收费调整系数为0.400澳门元/度。

- **注意事项**：
  电动车型号、电池状态、充电效率和模式存在差异，以上仅供参考，实际费用以充电时计费为准。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/transportation-charging---public/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/transportation-charging---public/"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "B组收费
适用于客户以中压或低压电网供电，其与本公司订定的视在功率在69千伏安或以上及每月耗电量达10,000千瓦时或以上。
标准电压
低压	 230/400伏特
中压	 11,000伏特
收费类别
B1	-	一般收费
B2	-	低压计算用电的客户
B3	-	低压供电的客户

收费
B组收费根据下列项目计算：
功率
－以千瓦作单位的功率，计算方式为：
	0.2Pc ＋ 0.8Pu 	
Pu	–在所指发单月份内以千瓦记录的最大功率数值。
		–B2收费的客户需缴交最大功率值的1%的附加费，用于补偿变压器铜损损耗； 	
	 –B3收费的客户需缴交最大功率值的2%的附加费，用于补偿变压器铜损损耗与低压输电损耗。
Pc	–订定功率以千瓦作单位。
	 –当Pu超越Pc时，Pc会被修订至Pu数值。而当Pu在12个月低于Pc时，Pc便会调低至Pu数值。
有功电能
－	以千瓦时记录。
	–B2收费的客户需缴交有功电能的1%的附加费，用于补偿变压器铜损损耗；
	–B3收费的客户需缴交有功电能的2%的附加费，用于补偿变压器铜损损耗与低压输电损耗。
无功电能
－	以千乏时记录。
	–若无功电能超过在同一时段内应付的有功电能的60%，此部分需缴交超过的无功电能数值。
	 –B2及B3收费的客户需缴交无功电能在同一时段内应付的有功电能的10%的附加费，用于补偿变压器的无功电能耗用",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/uploads/pdf_education_Tariff_B_zh_2574dad7f3.pdf",
        "topic": "B组收费条件以及计算方法"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "以下内容对用户有实际参考价值：

“一般充电收费即私人充电，适用设置于非属公共充电收费的充电设施且设置「时段收费」。一般充电收费是按每月总充电量收费并根据下列项目计算：

功率费（以千伏安计算）按供电合约所订定的最大电力负荷 (订定功率值)计算。

充电量就每发单月使用电力充电的总电量。

电能费用（以千瓦时（度）计算）按充电量计算。

收费调整系数 收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。

政府税就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。

价格
功率费订定功率功率费不高于3.4 千伏安8.224 (澳门元)高于3.4千伏安但不高于 6.9 千伏安18.796 (澳门元)高于6.9千伏安3.372 (澳门元/千伏安)

电能费用
收费时段时间电能费用
繁忙时间(11个小时)09:00 - 20:00 1.552 (澳门元/千瓦时)
非繁忙时间(13个小时)20:00 - 09:00 0.817 (澳门元/千瓦时)

计算方法：
充电费用 = 功率费 + (充电量 x (电能费用 + 收费调整系数)) + 政府税

范例：
单位单位价额 （澳门元） 金额（澳门元）
功率费6.9千伏安 18.80
电费 (繁忙时间)40度1.552 62.08
电费 (非繁忙时间)160度0.817 130.72
收费调整系数200度0.400 80.00
政府税（0.75 x √6.9） 2.00
合共 293.60”",

entities.description: 电力设备includes electrical appliances and systems that may be affected by flooding and require safety checks.
Metering equipment is used to measure energy consumption and demand, and is supplied and maintained by the Company.
智能及高端家电refers to smart and high-end appliances that enhance the quality of life and convenience, leading to increased energy demand.
Metering Systems are devices used to measure electricity consumption, for which the Company is responsible for maintenance and repair.
电能refers to the electricity consumed by residential customers, which is measured in degrees.
Costs refer to the financial responsibilities associated with the installation, maintenance, and operation of electrical systems and equipment.
能源效益标签是附于电器或其包装上的资料标签，由国家或地区政府认证，注明该电器的用电量、能源效益及其他性能的资料。
Billing Procedures outline the methods and timelines for charging Customers for their electricity consumption based on meter readings.
The Electricity Tariff Group categorizes the pricing structure for electricity supply based on usage and demand.
收费结构outlines how the charging fees are calculated, including power fees and energy costs.
收费类别refers to the different categories of charges applicable to customers based on their power consumption levels.
Charging Fees are the costs associated with charging electric vehicles, calculated based on power usage and time of day.
The Electricity Billing System refers to the procedures and regulations governing the billing and collection of electricity consumption.
Tariffs are the pricing structures applied to electricity supply contracts, which can vary based on customer type and usage.
Tariff refers to the pricing structure set by the Company for energy consumption, which is used to calculate charges for Customers.
收费示例provides examples of charging costs based on different charging speeds and times.

relationships.description: The Customer's Electricity Consumption is monitored and billed by the Company based on usage over time.
The Customer is responsible for their Energy Consumption, which is monitored and billed by the Company.
The Customer is allowed to use private electricity generation only under specific conditions set by the Company.
The Customer's electricity usage is monitored within their Residential Unit, where they have exclusive access.
The Company bills customers based on their electricity consumption, which is measured monthly.
非繁忙时间typically results in lower功率费due to reduced electricity usage.
Electricity Consumption is used to calculate the amount of the Guarantee that the Customer must provide under the contract.

住宅客户must specify their功率when applying for social assistance under the社会援助计划.<SEP>功率is a criterion that residential customers must meet to qualify for social assistance based on their electricity consumption.
高用电季节affects the rates for有功电能during peak usage times.

The Customer is entitled to demand repairs or replacements for the Electric Installation if fraud is not found.<SEP>The Customer's electric installation is affected during supply interruptions, which must be treated as live for safety reasons.
The Customer is responsible for the costs associated with the installation and maintenance of electrical systems and equipment.
The Customer is responsible for the maintenance and repair of their own installation, which includes various electrical components.
申请人需提供电力装置的位置图以申请更改功率。
The Company supplies and maintains metering equipment necessary for billing electricity consumption.
The Company is responsible for the maintenance and repair of the Metering Systems that measure electricity usage.
The Company is responsible for the Repair or Replacement of any equipment damaged as a result of fraudulent activities.
客户may need to change or install电力装置when applying for电力供应, indicating a direct relationship between their needs and the installations.
电费is calculated based on the total consumption, which is influenced by the customer's订定功率.
The政府税is included in the电费单, affecting the total amount due for electricity consumption.<SEP>电费单outlines the total amount due, which includes the government tax calculated on the electricity charges.
收费调整系数在Electricity Bill中反映电力成本的变化。

电费单includes detailed charges for electricity consumption, which are based on the电能费用per unit.<SEP>电费单provides a detailed breakdown of the电能费用incurred by the organization, including power and energy charges.
电力收费调整系数的变化直接影响电费的计算和客户的账单。
The Customer is billed according to the Tariff set by the Company based on their energy consumption subgroup.
The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.
CEM Macau issues the Electricity Bill to customers detailing their electricity usage and charges.
The Company establishes Tariffs that apply to different types of Electricity Supply Contracts based on customer needs.
CEM Macau establishes the charging fees based on power usage and time of day for electric vehicle charging.
电费单范例provides an example of how A组收费is calculated and presented on a bill.
政府税是Electricity Bill中包含的费用，客户需按月支付。
收费类别defines the different billing categories that fall under the B组收费structure.
The Company operates within the Electricity Billing System to manage billing and collection of electricity consumption from customers.
The Company implements the Billing and Collection Process to manage how bills are issued and payments are collected.

augmented_query: What factors influence the power consumption per unit in residential settings? How do electricity rates impact the total electricity bill for consumers?

query: 我和鄰居的電費額為何有所差別?
response:
### 电费差异原因

您和邻居的电费差异可能受多个因素影响，包括每户的电力消费情况、用电类别（如居民用电、商用电等）、订定功率以及收费调整系数等。此外，用电期间的用电量和高低峰用电时段也会影响电费。电力公司通常根据每户的实际用电量及相关费用按照合约定期计费，因此不同家庭的用电习惯会导致账单金额不同。

**
answer: 很多時候，客戶都會將其電費單與鄰居相比較, 結果當然不盡相同。電費金額會因應住宅面積大小，家庭成員的多少、年齡、電器的數量和品牌、使用的方法等等而有所不同。可見電力的消耗是受很多不同的因素影響。

    "page_content": "89Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
23.3 When suspicion of fraudulent procedure arises, the Company shall 
request the presence of two witnesses, duly credentialed by competent 
authorities, to confirm or deny the existence of fraud.
23.4 When the existence of fraud is confirmed and imputable to the 
Customer, the Company reserves the right:
a) To be reimbursed for the amount corresponding to energy 
illicitly consumed and of any expenses related to the 
elimination of the fraud, namely the repair or replacement 
of damaged equipment;
b) To withhold supply until full payment is made of the amount 
due according to the previous subparagraph.
24. Value of energy illicitly consumed  (24)
24.1 The value of the energy illicitly consumed is computed by the 
Company, based on the highest tariff set for the subgroup contracted 
by the Customer, plus 25%, taking into account all the facts relevant 
to the computation of real consumption during the period wherein 
the fraudulent procedure took place, namely the characteristics of the 
installation, its schedule of operation, previous readings, if any, and 
posterior readings, if necessary.
24.2 When there are no elements to allow an objective computation of 
energy illicitly consumed, the relevant value is computed using the 
following rules:
a) Low-voltage Customers
Pc up to 20.7 kV A ................. 50-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 34.5kV A to 69 kV ..... 70-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 100 kV A to 340 kV A .100-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc above 340 kV A ........... 200-hour monthly usage of Pc
b) Medium-voltage Customers .... 300-hour monthly usage of Pc
Whereof “Pc” is the demand subscribed by the Customer
24.3 Estimation performed in the terms of the previous paragraph 
comprises the period in relation thereto proof was presented wherein 
such irregular consumption was maintained or, if such evidence does 
not exist, a period of thirty-six months.",

{
    "page_content": "A组收费
适用于以低压电网(230/400伏特)供电的客户：
•   其订定功率在69千伏安以下，或
•   其订定功率高于69千伏安，但未被包括在B组及C组收费内。

收费类别
A1 - 一般收费
A2 - 平民收费
A3 - 社会慈善机构收费
A4 - 社会援助收费

收费
A组收费根据下列项目计算：
订定功率2 (以千伏安计算)
•   供电合约所订定的最大电力负荷，由电表规格及其保护设备所控制。
电费 (以千瓦时(度)计算)
•   于用电期间的总耗电量。
收费调整系数
•   收费按季度而调整以反映电力生产成本上的浮动。
政府税
•   就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。
备注
(1) 86年8月30日之第35/86/M号法令。
(2) 2005年7月18日之第11/2005号行政法规。
(3) 2004年8月9日之第23/2004号行政命令。  
(4) 2007年3月19日之第5/2007号行政法规。
(5) 税项的计算方式按客户电力装置种类而定（住宅、商业或工业）。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/uploads/pdf_education_Tariff_A_zh_881af653dd.pdf",
        "topic": "A组收费方法以及记算"
    }
}

    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

{
    "page_content": "
了解我的账单

1. 合约号：当查询供电事宜或账单时，请提供此号码。
2. 应付总金额：应缴费用的总数。
3. 到期付款日：客户须于此日期或之前缴付电费。若逾期缴费，将在下月账单内征收逾期附加费。
4. 自动转账资料（只适用于自动转账客户）：此栏印有自动转账的银行名称及过数日期。
5. 下月抄表日期：安排于此日期抄读用电度数。
6. 用电时期：上月抄表日期至本月抄表日期及之间的用电天数。
7. 用电量（度）：将本月读数与上月读数相减，再乘以乘数值。
8. 按金：按订定功率值（电表大小）计算，用以保证客户依时缴付所有电费。
9. 收费调整系数：按季度调整以反映电力生产和购买之成本上的浮动。
10. 政府税：就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/understand-my-bill/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/understand-my-bill/"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "C组收费
C组收费适用于以中压电网供电及订定功率不低于1,000千伏安或857千瓦的客户。
C组客户可改变其电力收费组别，但需至少有一个月在所定的高用电季节月份内以该组收费缴纳电费。
 
标准电压
低压 230/400伏特
中压 11,000伏特
 
收费类别
C1 -  一般收费
C2 -  低压计算用电的客户
收费
C组收费根据下列项目计算:
功率
 － 以千瓦作单位的功率，计算方式为：
    0.2Pc + 0.8Pu
Pu  –在所指发单月份内以千瓦记录的最大功率数值。
    –C2收费的客户需缴交最大功率值的1%的附加费，用于补偿变压器铜损损耗。
Pc  –订定功率以千瓦作单位。
    –当Pu超越Pc时，Pc会被修订至Pu数值。而当Pu在12个月低于Pc时，Pc便会调低至Pu数值。
有功电能－ 以千瓦时记 录。
  –C2收费的客户需缴交有功电能的1%的附加费，用于补偿变压器铜损损耗。
无功电能－ 以千乏时记 录。
  –在满负荷及繁忙时间内录取的无功电能，指从电网输送到客户装置的无功电能。若无功电能超过在同一时段内应付的有功电能的60%，需缴交超过的无功电能数值；
  –在非繁忙时间内录取的无功电能，指由客户装置输往电网的无功电能，将被计算在内；
  –C2收费的客户需缴交或减收无功电能在同一时段内应付的有功电能的10%的附加费，用于补偿变压器的无功电能耗用。其附加费将于满负荷及繁忙时间内收取，于非繁忙时间内减收。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/uploads/pdf_education_Tariff_C_zh_0da3b45407.pdf",
        "topic": "C组收费条件以及计算方法"
    }
}

    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the

been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable

    "page_content": "88
Final Provisions
22. Private generation  (22)
22.1 A Customer with private electricity generation is allowed to use the 
energy generated by its own plant only in case of emergency and 
limited duration tests, except for specially authorized cases under the 
terms and conditions to be provided in the relevant supply contract.
22.2 The Customer, when signing the electricity supply contract or later, 
upon installation, is obliged to inform the Company, in written, of the 
existence at the premises of its own means of generation.
22.3 Except through written permission from the Company, attached as 
schedule to the relevant electricity supply contract including technical 
rules to be observed, a Customer who owns a private electricity 
generator is not allowed to operate its own plant in parallel with the 
public network.
23. Fraud (23)
23.1 Any fraudulent procedure susceptible to forge the reading of energy 
or the demand, namely the capture of electricity prior (“upstream”) 
to the meter, tampering of meters or demand control devices, as well 
as alterations to safety devices performed through the breaking of the 
seal or lock, is considered a noncompliance of the electricity supply 
contract.
23.2 Any fraudulent procedures detected within an installation that uses 
electricity located inside a residential unit or any other compound or 
location wherein the Customer has exclusive access or subjected to 
the control thereof, is considered, unless otherwise proven, imputable 
to the Customer.",

{
    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

entities.description: The Electricity Tariff Group categorizes the pricing structure for electricity supply based on usage and demand.
Monthly Usage refers to the estimated consumption of electricity by Customers, which is used to calculate charges in cases of fraud.

Electricity Consumption refers to the amount of electricity used by customers, which is measured and billed monthly.<SEP>Electricity Consumption refers to the usage of electrical power by the Customer, which is subject to billing and monitoring by the Company.<SEP>Electricity Consumption refers to the amount of electricity used by the Customer, which is a factor in calculating the guarantee amount.
Usage Period indicates the timeframe for which electricity consumption is measured, from the last reading to the current reading.
Energy Consumption refers to the usage of electrical energy by Customers, which is monitored and billed by the Company.
电能refers to the electricity consumed by residential customers, which is measured in degrees.
高用电季节refers to the high electricity usage season from June to September.
Energy Metering refers to the process of measuring energy consumption and demand, which is essential for accurate billing and service provision.
Metering equipment is used to measure energy consumption and demand, and is supplied and maintained by the Company.

relationships.description: The Customer's Electricity Consumption is monitored and billed by the Company based on usage over time.
The Customer is responsible for their Energy Consumption, which is monitored and billed by the Company.
电费is calculated based on the total consumption, which is influenced by the customer's订定功率.
电表measures the electricity consumption that directly impacts the calculation of电费.
The Company bills customers based on their electricity consumption, which is measured monthly.
收费调整系数在Electricity Bill中反映电力成本的变化。

电费单includes detailed charges for electricity consumption, which are based on the电能费用per unit.<SEP>电费单provides a detailed breakdown of the电能费用incurred by the organization, including power and energy charges.
C2 customers are also charged based on their usage of无功电能, which affects their overall electricity costs.
The Electricity Bill includes the Government Tax as part of the total amount due for electricity usage.
The Company supplies and maintains metering equipment necessary for billing electricity consumption.
The Company is responsible for managing energy metering processes to ensure accurate billing for customers.
The Company uses Estimation Rules to calculate energy consumption when actual data is not available, especially in cases of fraud.
The 2021 First Quarter is a previous period when CEM Macau adjusted its tariffs based on production costs.
The 2020 First Quarter is a previous period when CEM Macau adjusted its tariffs based on production costs.
The 2022 First Quarter is a previous period when CEM Macau adjusted its tariffs based on production costs.
Electricity Consumption is used to calculate the amount of the Guarantee that the Customer must provide under the contract.
The Meter Reading is conducted to assess the Customer's electricity consumption for billing purposes.
The Customer's electricity usage is monitored within their Residential Unit, where they have exclusive access.
The Company conducts Meter Reading to determine the amount of electricity consumed for billing purposes.
用电量是Electricity Bill中计算的电力消耗量，影响应付总金额。
The Usage Period is reflected in the Electricity Bill, showing the duration of electricity consumption.
C2 customers are charged based on their usage of active and reactive power as measured by the电网.
The Company is responsible for conducting Meter Readings to ensure accurate billing of the Customer's electricity usage.
The Company implements Billing Procedures to charge the Customer based on Meter Readings.
CEM Macau issues the Electricity Bill to customers detailing their electricity usage and charges.
The Company is responsible for the maintenance and repair of the Metering Systems that measure electricity usage.
The Company installs the metering system to monitor electricity usage at the Customer's installation.
政府税是Electricity Bill中包含的费用，客户需按月支付。

augmented_query: What factors can cause differences in electricity bills between neighbors? How is electricity consumption measured for residential properties?

query: 如租戶沒有繳交電費，而我是該住宅單位的電力供應合約持有人，請問我是否須負上責任？
response:
## 电费责任查询

作为住宅单位的电力供应合同持有人，如果租户未缴交电费，你可能会承担支付未付账单的责任。根据相关条款，电力公司有权在租户未付款的情况下暂时停止电力供应，并可能要求合同持有人解决这些未支付的账单。因此，建议与租户沟通，确保电费按时缴交，以避免潜在的责任和服务中断。

###
answer: 是。由於您為該單位的電力供應合約持有人，所以有責任承擔該住宅單位的電費。為保障自己個人利益，建議您在房屋出租或賣出前15天 透過網上服務或親臨澳電客戶聯繫中心辦理合約轉名手續。

docs.content:
{
    "page_content": "
了解我的账单

1. 合约号：当查询供电事宜或账单时，请提供此号码。
2. 应付总金额：应缴费用的总数。
3. 到期付款日：客户须于此日期或之前缴付电费。若逾期缴费，将在下月账单内征收逾期附加费。
4. 自动转账资料（只适用于自动转账客户）：此栏印有自动转账的银行名称及过数日期。
5. 下月抄表日期：安排于此日期抄读用电度数。
6. 用电时期：上月抄表日期至本月抄表日期及之间的用电天数。
7. 用电量（度）：将本月读数与上月读数相减，再乘以乘数值。
8. 按金：按订定功率值（电表大小）计算，用以保证客户依时缴付所有电费。
9. 收费调整系数：按季度调整以反映电力生产和购买之成本上的浮动。
10. 政府税：就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。",

    }
}

{
    "page_content": "85Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
19. Billing and collection  (19)
19.1 Electricity consumed is billed on a monthly basis, pursuant to a tariff 
system ﬁxed by the Macau Special Administrative Region.
19.2 The Company shall deliver the bill, whereof the consumption, the 
elements necessary to its veri ﬁcation and the amount due are contained, 
at the site of consumption or any other location indicated by the 
Customer, within a maximum period of three working days from the 
reading.
19.3 If by reasons imputable to the Customer, or by force majeure, the meter 
could not be read, the bill shall be issued for the corresponding period 
according to the average of consumption recorded during the previous 
twelve months or, if such is not feasible, the average of the consumption 
recorded to date, whereof corresponding demand is always due.
19.4 The consumption referred to under the previous paragraph shall be 
cleared against the billing of subsequent readings, whereof the bill is 
computed through relevant tariff.
19.5 The payment of the bill is due in a maximum of ﬁfteen days, counted 
from the reading date, at the ofﬁce of the Company or through institutions 
and methods indicated on the back of the bill.
19.6 In the same manner and within the same term, the Customer is obliged to 
pay the services rendered by the Company as well as any legal charges 
due.
19.7 The Customer shall by no means whatsoever retain or deduct any part 
of the amount due.
19.8 Failure to pay the bill on or before the payment due date, which shall be 
written on the bill, is levied with a surcharge over the amount due, ﬁxed 
by the Macau Special Administrative Region, whereof the Company 
may also suspend the energy supply after ﬁve working days from such 
date.",

{
    "page_content": "82
15.9 Notices of supply interruption shall contain a warning of live 
installations.
16. Suspension of supply  (16)
16.1 The Company may suspend the supply of electricity when any of the 
following events imputable to the Customer occur:
a) Noncompliance with provisions that aim to eliminate 
any type of disruption to network operation and other 
installations, as well as in concern to the safety of persons 
and property;
b) Impossibility to read meters as covered by clause 17 
hereof;
c) Opposition to inspection of installations within the 
appointed schedule;
d) Failure to pay bills for energy consumption and demand, as 
well as any additional charges and services, within the term 
provided;
e) Fraud, as provided under paragraph 23.4;
f) Failure to update the guarantee within the term provided 
after being served notice to that effect by the Company;
g) In the situation provided under paragraph 9.4;
h) Failure to regularize default situations provided under 
paragraph 1.4 or clause 22, hereof, within the term provided 
to that effect by the Company.
16.2 Interruption of supply in situation provided under the previous 
paragraph shall not exempt the Customer from possible civil or 
criminal liability.
16.3 In the case provided under subparagraph 16.1 d), the Company 
reserves the right to withhold reconnection from the Customer until 
all outstanding bills are paid and, if necessary, the guarantee referred 
to under clause 4, hereof duly replenished, wherefore reconnection is 
subject to the payment of a charge in the terms of the Law.",

{
    "page_content": "90
25. Customer’s rights (25)
25.1 The Customer is granted the right to apply from the inspection 
entity:
a) An inspection of the electric installation if convinced not to 
be the perpetrator of any fraud;
b) An arbitration on the indemnity to be paid to the Customer 
for unreasonable termination or suspension of supply on 
the part of the Company;
c) An arbitration over the amount paid in consequence of the 
fraudulent behavior, when considered excessive.
25.2 When through the inspection referred to in subparagraph a) of the 
previous paragraph, it has been found that there is no fraud or the 
fraud is not imputable to the Customer, the Customer may demand 
from the Company the repair or replacement deemed necessary to 
restore the electric installation to its proper working condition and 
the immediate reconnection of electricity supply.
26. Jurisdiction  (26)
 The Court of Law in the Macau Special Administrative Region will 
entertain jurisdiction over any disputes that may arise between the 
Customer and the Company.",

{
    "page_content": "86
20. Metering and billing errors (20)
20.1 Whenever errors or anomalies are found in energy and demand 
metering, such must be corrected through available elements.
20.2 In order to perform such correction, the Company must consider the 
characteristics of the Customer’s installation, its operational schedule, 
the latest bills presented before the detection of such error or anomaly, 
the amounts read after the correction of such error or anomaly and any 
other elements that may contribute to a more exact computation of the 
amount in question.
20.3 The limit of the amount demandable for credits which result from the 
correction of metering errors or anomalies, shall be determined by 
the sum of the amounts corresponding to the corrections applicable 
to a maximum period of twelve months prior to the month wherein 
any one of the parties expressly noti ﬁed the other of such error or 
anomaly, added the amount corresponding to the corrections to be 
made, up to the date wherein such error or anomaly was repaired.
20.4 The amount due shall not accrue interest and the payment thereof may 
be performed within a period equal to that wherein the error or anomaly 
has lasted, provided such period is no longer than six months.
20.5 Failure to pay any debits due on the part of the Customer from 
corrections hereinbefore referred to, within the established term, shall 
set the Customer under the nonpayment provisions of clause 19.
20.6 The hereinbefore provided shall also apply in case of error in reading 
and billing energy consumption.
20.7 In case of error in favor of the Company, the same shall issue a credit 
note in favor of the Customer, which may be used to pay for subsequent 
bill or bills or be received in cash at the Company’s cashiers.",

{
    "page_content": "89Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
23.3 When suspicion of fraudulent procedure arises, the Company shall 
request the presence of two witnesses, duly credentialed by competent 
authorities, to confirm or deny the existence of fraud.
23.4 When the existence of fraud is confirmed and imputable to the 
Customer, the Company reserves the right:
a) To be reimbursed for the amount corresponding to energy 
illicitly consumed and of any expenses related to the 
elimination of the fraud, namely the repair or replacement 
of damaged equipment;
b) To withhold supply until full payment is made of the amount 
due according to the previous subparagraph.
24. Value of energy illicitly consumed  (24)
24.1 The value of the energy illicitly consumed is computed by the 
Company, based on the highest tariff set for the subgroup contracted 
by the Customer, plus 25%, taking into account all the facts relevant 
to the computation of real consumption during the period wherein 
the fraudulent procedure took place, namely the characteristics of the 
installation, its schedule of operation, previous readings, if any, and 
posterior readings, if necessary.
24.2 When there are no elements to allow an objective computation of 
energy illicitly consumed, the relevant value is computed using the 
following rules:
a) Low-voltage Customers
Pc up to 20.7 kV A ................. 50-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 34.5kV A to 69 kV ..... 70-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc from 100 kV A to 340 kV A .100-hour monthly usage of Pc
Pc above 340 kV A ........... 200-hour monthly usage of Pc
b) Medium-voltage Customers .... 300-hour monthly usage of Pc
Whereof “Pc” is the demand subscribed by the Customer
24.3 Estimation performed in the terms of the previous paragraph 
comprises the period in relation thereto proof was presented wherein 
such irregular consumption was maintained or, if such evidence does 
not exist, a period of thirty-six months.",

    "page_content": "转名 申请人: 必须为业权人或租户  
所需文件:  
1. 业权人身份证明文件副本  
2. 最近三个月发出的查屋纸  
3. 电费单  
如申请人为租户，另须提供:  
1. 租户的身份证明文件副本  
2. 已公证的租约副本  
如申请单位为非住宅用途，另须提供:  
1. “电力装置用途/电业工程人员声明书”及土地工务局发出的电力装置使用许可证  
应付费用: 申请合同尚未缴付的电费按金 (根据所申请的订定功率收取)  
所需时间: 即时办理  
备注: 如申请人未能亲身办理申请，可签署授权书以委托他人代办。  
[2] 澳门居民身份证、香港居民身份证、中华人民共和国居民身份证或各国护照。
[3] 如申请人为公司/社团，须提供最近三个月发出的公司商业/社团登记副本及其电能供应合约须由法定代表人签署。
[4] 如最近三个月发出的查屋纸仍未更改为新的业权人，客户可再递交经律师见证的买卖楼宇合约／银行三方约／屋契／物业转移税单（M1&M2）副本作参考，但需审批。
[5] 如以租户身份申请，则无需提供业权人的身份证明文件副本。
[6] 此声明书须由申请人或公司/ 社团的法定代表人签署。「电业工程人员声明书」部份只适用于具备电力装置使用准照的供电申请及更改订定功率申请。
[7] 指电力装置属第35 /2011 号行政法规的适用范围内。
[8] 指澳电已确认申请人所提交之文件，并已缴付相应费用。",

{
    "page_content": "91Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
Schedule 1 - Guarantee to be given by 
Customers
Guarantee to be given by Customers for electricity 
supply contracts
1. Type of guarantee
 (27)
1.1 The guarantee is given by the Customer in cash or any other means of 
payment on demand.
1.2 When the electricity supply contracts involve subscribed demand 
higher than 340 kV A, the Customer may grant suretyship by means 
of a bank guarantee or insurance-guarantee, compliant with sample 
included under Schedule 2 hereof, wherefore charges in result thereof 
shall also run on the account of the Customer.
2. Calculation of the amount of the guarantee (28)
2.1 The amount of the guarantee corresponds to the cost of the energy 
consumed within a certain amount of hours of subscribed demand 
(Pc) usage, as follows:
a) Pc up to 100 kV A .... 60 hours
b) Pc from 100 kV A to 1600 kV A .... 120 hours
c) Pc above 1600 kV A .... 160 hours
2.2 When computing the amount of the guarantee, the general tariff class 
A1 in force on the date of the guarantee shall be taken into account.
2.3 In case of short-term temporary contracts, the guarantee shall be 
double that computed in the terms of the previous paragraphs.
2.4 To the effect of the previous paragraph, any contract signed for or less 
than a 45-day term is considered a short-term temporary contract.",

{
    "page_content": "73Standard Conditions of Supply of Electricity Ė
6.3 The validity of special large Customers’ contracts, as well as the 
status of their operation, tariffs and applicable tariff periods as well 
as any other particular provisions shall be established on a case-by-
case basis and shall be covered by the relevant supply contract.
7. Temporary contracts  (7)
7.1 The Company may sign temporary electricity supply contracts for 
non-permanent installations, for a pre-determined limited term, 
provided technical conditions are favorable to that effect and that 
inconvenience to the distribution network may not result therefrom.
7.2 Temporary electricity supply contracts imply the installation of 
provisional branch lines.
8. Contractual term  (8)
8.1 Ordinary electricity supply contracts are signed for an initial term of 
one month, automatically and successively renewable for the same 
period, notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph 8.3 hereof.
8.2 Temporary contracts have a limited term, wherefore the beginning 
and the end of their validity is explicitly set in the supply contract.
8.3 The Customer, in written and with a minimum notice of five working 
days, must inform the Company of his/her intention to terminate any 
contract signed under the terms provided in paragraphs 8.1 and 8.2 
hereof, wherefore the Customer shall be liable for any amount due 
until the removal of the meters, which shall be carried out during the 
same period.
8.4 The term for special large customer contracts is specified in the 
respective supply contract pursuant to clause 6 hereof.",

{
    "page_content": "92
3. Guarantee update (29)
3.1 When the requested alteration aims to increase the subscribed 
demand, the Company may constraint the efficacy of such contractual 
alteration to the reinforcement of the relevant guarantee, based on the 
general tariff class A1 in effect on the date such reinforcement is 
made.
3.2 When the requested alteration aims to decrease the subscribed 
demand, the Company shall inform the Customer, as the case may be, 
that he may:
a) Opt to receive the difference from the guarantee, in cash 
or in cheque, or clear the same against the payment of 
consumption and other charges to be included in subsequent 
bills;
b) Choose to replace the guarantee provided under paragraph 
1.2.
3.3 Provided there is no increase to subscribed demand, no update of 
guarantee shall be required from Customers who change tariff rate or 
if being signers of more than a contract for the same building, change 
the number of such contracts.
4. Lapse of the guarantee  (30)
4.1 The lapse of a contract implies the obligation of the Company to 
reimburse the Customer of the amount equal to the guarantee, with 
deduction of any amount eventually due.
4.2 When the guarantee is granted through any of the methods provided 
under paragraph 1.2 hereof and there is no amount due, the lapse of 
the contract shall bind the Company to issue a document whereby it 
renounces to the guarantee.",

{
    "page_content": "84
Sale of Electricity
17. Metering of energy and demand  (17)
17.1 In general, energy consumed and demand subscribed by the Customer 
are evaluated through direct measurement performed with metering 
equipment and respective fittings.
17.2 Metering equipment and respective fittings, of the type that has been 
officially approved and duly calibrated and sealed, required for billing, 
are supplied, installed and maintained solely by the Company.
17.3 The reading of the Customer’s meter is performed periodically, in 
preestablished days, the date thereof shall be written on the bill of the 
latest month.
17.4 If reading is not performed on a monthly basis or if reading has not 
been taken due to Customer’s absence or any other reason imputable 
thereto, the bill shall be issued pursuant to paragraph 19.3 hereof.
17.5 If due to systematic absence or other reason imputable to the 
Customer, the reading is not performed for four consecutive months, 
the Company reserves the right to suspend electricity supply to the 
Customer, notwithstanding any action deemed necessary for the 
settlement of any debts due.
18. Tariffs  (18)
 Electricity tariffs and tariff periods are fixed by the Macau Special 
Administrative Region.",

entities.description: Electricity Bill refers to the statement detailing the amount owed for electricity usage, including various charges and due dates.
The Electricity Billing System refers to the procedures and regulations governing the billing and collection of electricity consumption.
Outstanding Bills refer to unpaid charges for energy consumption and services that the Customer owes to The Company.
The Billing and Collection Process outlines the procedures for issuing bills and collecting payments for electricity services.
Customer's Rights refer to the entitlements granted to customers regarding inspections, arbitration, and service quality related to electric supply.
Billing Errors are mistakes in the invoicing process that can lead to incorrect charges for energy consumption.
The Law refers to legal provisions governing the supply of electricity and the rights of the Company regarding reconnection and payments.
The grantee is the individual or entity receiving the electricity supply and is responsible for payment under the contract.
Obligations refer to the responsibilities and duties that the Customer must fulfill under the terms of the electricity supply agreement.
The Tenancy Agreement is a legal document that outlines the terms of rental agreements between landlords and tenants.

Electricity Supply Contracts refer to agreements made between the Company and Customers for the provision of electricity services.<SEP>Electricity supply contracts refer to agreements between customers and suppliers regarding the provision of electricity, including terms for guarantees and payment.
The Contract is a formal agreement between the Company and the Customer outlining the terms of service, guarantees, and obligations.

augmented_query: What are the legal responsibilities of the electricity supply contract holder if the tenant fails to pay the electricity bill? Is there a specific policy regarding the liability of electricity contract holders for unpaid bills by tenants?

query: 什麼是收費調整系數？
response:
### 收费调整系数概述

收费调整系数是一个用于根据特定标准调整电费的系数，主要用于反映电力生产和购买成本的变化。它每季度一次进行调整，以确保电费的公平性和准确性，直接影响客户的电费计算，包括充电费用和电力费用。

###
answer: 收費調整系數是根據上一季度重油、天然氣及電力輸入的成本而定。該系數每一季度都會作出一次調整，根據二零零七年三月十九日第5/2007號行政法規， 該收費調整系數對所有收費組別及能源單位(kWh)有效。

{
    "page_content": "**公共充电收费 — 运输工具充电收费**

- **适用范围**：
  适用于中压或低压供电，专门针对用于电动运输工具的充电设施。
  公共充电指由澳电配置在公共停车场、公共泊车处或非设于公共道路泊车处的充电设施。

- **收费结构**：
  充电费用 = 功率费 + (充电量 × (电能费用 + 收费调整系数))

- **收费示例（以48度电为例）**：
  - 慢速充电（繁忙时间，约7小时）：48 × (2.150 + 0.400) = 122.40 澳门元
  - 慢速充电（非繁忙时间，约7小时）：48 × (1.420 + 0.400) = 87.36 澳门元
  - 中速充电（全天24小时，约2.5小时）：48 × (2.980 + 0.400) = 162.24 澳门元
  - 快速充电（全天24小时，约1.5小时）：48 × (3.440 + 0.400) = 184.32 澳门元

- **收费调整系数**：
  2024年第2季度收费调整系数为0.400澳门元/度。

- **注意事项**：
  电动车型号、电池状态、充电效率和模式存在差异，以上仅供参考，实际费用以充电时计费为准。",
    "metadata": {
        "source": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/transportation-charging---public/",
        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/billing-service/transportation-charging---public/"
    }
}

{
    "page_content": "以下内容对用户有实际参考价值：

“一般充电收费即私人充电，适用设置于非属公共充电收费的充电设施且设置「时段收费」。一般充电收费是按每月总充电量收费并根据下列项目计算：

{
    "page_content": "2022电费补贴措施

澳电全力配合澳门特区政府推出的2022电费补贴纾困措施，是次补贴分「家居」（住宅）及「企业商号」两个类别，分别为每月300澳门元及3,000澳门元，补贴发放时期均为2022年6月至11月的发单月份，合共6个月，发放期间未使用之补贴可于2022年12月至2023年5月的发单月份内以相同每月上限使用。

于补贴使用期限后，倘若尚有未使用的电费补贴余额，则会全数自动注销。此外，期间若取消供电合约或更改供电合约名称，累积未使用的电费补贴余额亦将全数自动注销。

「2022家居及企业商号电费补贴措施」合共超过27万客户受惠，覆盖达98%总用户。受惠的住宅客户为现时享有每月200澳门元「政府电费补贴」的用户，是次补贴措施将会每月补贴每户300澳门元，补贴范围包括支付该月电费，即功率费、电费、收费调整系数及政府税四项，其他费用如逾期附加费等不属补贴范围。

补贴扣减次序为1) 当月200澳门元「政府电费补贴」、2) 300澳门元「2022家居电费补贴措施」。而企业商号方面，除娱乐场、三星或以上酒店场所，以及政府部门的电力供应合约外，其余所有企业商号均能受惠，是次补贴措施将会每月补贴每户3,000澳门元，A组的补贴范围包括支付该月电费，即功率费、电费、收费调整系数及政府税四项；而B组及C组则包括功率费、有功及无功电能、收费调整系数及政府税。

补贴扣减次序为1) 豁免无功电能费用（如有）、2) 支持霓虹招牌用电计划（如有）、3) 3,000澳门元「2022企业商号电费补贴措施」。由于以「发单月」计算补贴期限，故每户每月的补贴起始日均不同，并不是一致地由每月的第1日开始计算。此外，由于每月补贴用以支付该月的电费，请市民避免估算账单；如收到估算账单，可联络澳电自报读数或预约抄表，以实际用电量调整有关电费补贴。

补贴金额将在账单内以「2022家居电费补贴措施」及「2022企业商号电费补贴措施」标示，请市民留意。澳电已就相关补贴的各项细节安排做好准备，亦呼吁市民继续保持良好用电习惯，切勿浪费能源。澳电已就「2022家居及企业商号电费补贴措施」等制成图文包并上传至澳电Facebook专页及微信，常见问题集亦上载于澳电网站www.cem-macau.com，欢迎市民下载及转发。

如有疑问，请致电资询通2833 9911或于澳电微信或网站内向「聊天机械人」查询。",

        "loc": "https://www.cem-macau.com/zh/customer-service/subsidy/"
    }
}

    "page_content": "
了解我的账单

1. 合约号：当查询供电事宜或账单时，请提供此号码。
2. 应付总金额：应缴费用的总数。
3. 到期付款日：客户须于此日期或之前缴付电费。若逾期缴费，将在下月账单内征收逾期附加费。
4. 自动转账资料（只适用于自动转账客户）：此栏印有自动转账的银行名称及过数日期。
5. 下月抄表日期：安排于此日期抄读用电度数。
6. 用电时期：上月抄表日期至本月抄表日期及之间的用电天数。
7. 用电量（度）：将本月读数与上月读数相减，再乘以乘数值。
8. 按金：按订定功率值（电表大小）计算，用以保证客户依时缴付所有电费。
9. 收费调整系数：按季度调整以反映电力生产和购买之成本上的浮动。
10. 政府税：就每月使用电力装置所需缴纳的税项。",
